Summary: Even though the hotel is under renovations, it was lovely. The room was spacious and clean. The hallways had fans to keep air moving as well as our room.  There was a lot of natural wood, which we love.   The breakfast was outstanding. Hit and cold cereals, yogurt, hot items served to you, including 2 types of eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, potatoes, lots of bread and bagel choices with toppings. Excellent! The staff was very friendly. This was a last minute reservation and they were most accommodating.

Excellent hotel and great staff. Highly recommend. Free breakfast. Quiet. Serene. Clean.  Pool. Jacuzzi.  Enjoyed the rooms. Great service. Very accommodating staff. Overall a great experience. I always there when I visit SOCAL.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a  Weekend Getaway
Summary: My husband and I decided to go for an overnighter in Orange County.  The Ayres Suites Mission Viejo is an easy drive from the Long Beach area.   It is off the freeway up in the foothills.  The hotel has a lovely view.  The rooms are very roomy and comfortable.  The room has a work desk, a microwave, and a small refrigerator.  The hot  breakfast was very good, with a nice variety of choices.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Room tip: If you like this hotel, there are other Ayres Hotels in the Southern California area.  You may...

Summary Heading: Home Away From Home During Remodel
Summary: The 7 plus day rate was excellent, but doesn't count towards frequent stayer program. King size bed more comfortable than our queen size bed at home. The sleeper sofa mattress was not as comfortable. Hot breakfast was included (bacon on Saturdays). Sometimes breakfast was at the hotel next door where you can make your own waffles vs. pancakes. Pet friendly. The staff at the Mission Viejo Ayres Hotel were amazing. We stayed for 20 nights. They provided extra towels, floor mats, sheets, and even utensils one night. The mini fridge worked great and we loved the ice machine for our cooler. Plenty parking spaces. Never got a chance to use the pool or jacuzzi (too hot, ash from fires, too busy). There's vending machine with a great variety of drinks. Didn't use the laundry or gym.

Hotel is very clean and spacious. Very good customer service. Love the swimming pool and heated Spa. Breakfast was good. Parking lot is very convenenient. Close to Rancho Santa Margarita and El Toro. Those Tacos were very good.
Room tip: Will recommend to my family and friends. 3rd floor room is very quiet.

Summary Heading: Our home away from home near our grandson's family
Summary: Ayres recently redecorated the guest rooms and dining area.  I do wish the bed was a little more comfortable though... every time my husband moved I bounced!  They have resumed serving a full breakfast, whereas many other places still have the grab and go, inferior options.  The breakfast options are very good, and the dining area large and very inviting.  We will return each time we are in the area.  Ayres have lovely accommodations for a reasonable price!
Room tip: There is construction going on behind the hotel, so if you like to sleep in, pick a room on the...

Summary: We recently stayed in the Mission Viejo Ayres Hotel. The facility was comfortable, relaxing, and maintained well. We enjoyed time spent by the pool, and it was helpful to start each day with a hot breakfast. All staff members were courteous and pleasant! The location was central to everywhere we wanted to go. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again, if in the area.

Excellent facility that met all our needs. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room exceeded expectations. Complimentary breakfast was freshly prepared and served with a smile. My second visit and I will always stay there when visiting Rancho Santa Margarita.

Emily at front desk was GREAT!  Clean elegant lobby.  Missing hot cookies at night.  Room was clean,  although comforter had small stain.  Wife is a little picky.  Bed should be away from air conditioner (less noise). Shower worked well and was very clean.  Tv good size and selection. Nice art down the hallway and displayed at elevator.  Boutique hotel -Yes.  Breakfast,  more care not to overcook sausage and pancakes, warm tortillas would be nice. Overall well organized  and functional.  Will definitely stay here again.

The Ayres hotel offered breakfast, convenient location, comfortable beds, clean room, and allowed our dog to be with us. Our stay was perfect! The room was immaculately clean, quiet, and had everything we needed. Location was perfect; close to the 241 toll road and also close to restaurants and groceries.

We stay here several times a year. It is our 1st choice. We've stayed at other Ayres Hotels and they are all a good value for the nightly rate. The rooms are always clean. Easy on/off the 241 toll road in OC.

This is a 3 star hotel.  The corridors are very long and it is carpeted throughout.  There are paintings on the walls and collections of plates and figurines on display. The rooms are very basic as are the amenities.  There is no housekeeping service.  The corridors smelled of marijuana most days.   The breakfast was basic and no COVID-19 precautions were taken. Not the best experience.
Manager Response: Dear Marilyn S,  Thank you for writing a review based on your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to our complimentary breakfast and the surrounding smell throughout your time with us. If you are ever experiencing any issues, please let our team know so we can work to get them resolved in a timely manner. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a stellar visit the next time you're in town.  Sincerely,  Hayley Burbank General Manager

Summary: We almost always stay at Ayres when we travel to Orange county. Most recently we tried a newly built hotel closer to my office. Never again! The Ayres Suites have large comfortable rooms, no traffic noise, and great beds where I can sleep comfortably and awaken refreshed.  I would have rated 5 stars, but they are still on restricted Housekeeping; I can make my own bed but wish there was daily trash and towel service.

Summary Heading: Best long term stay hotel ever!!
Summary: My husband and I had to stay in a hotel with our dog for a month. The staff made our stay so easy. They were always friendly and welcoming. The rooms were great! I definitely recommend this hotel for personal or business!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel when you travel with a dog
Summary: Clean, roomy, conveinently located to shopping , restaurants and freeways.  There is a nice park ( Flo Jo Olympiad ) that you can walk your dog along with Lake Mission Viejo a few miles away.  Stayed for a week and would definitely return.

Stayed one night. We're a local resident having home construction and needed a safe, clean, reasonably priced place to stay the night. The staff is very friendly, the room was very clean, the location and price were perfect. I would recommend to family and friends.

Loved the recent renovations! Our suite was perfect and we will definitely return! Stay in the building to the left as you enter the property! You will walk to the other building for breakfast, but the tecent remodeling of the guestrooms is worth the little inconvenience.

The hotel was clean, room very clean and service and staff were great very kind and helpful. location is quite and nice located. Breakfast was really good. i would stay again and i will recommended to friends and family.

I put my brother and sister-in-law up a the MV Ayres Suites as I live in Mission Viejo and they loved it.  They stayed seven nights so I got a great rate of $70/night.  It was perfect for them and easy on me!  They enjoyed the onsite complimentary breakfast.  Ayres were only cleaning every three days due to Covid but my brother said it wasn't a problem as they brought them clean towels whenever they asked for them.

This will be our second time staying at Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo, while we were in OC for a soccer tournaments. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean and the outdoor courtyard provided a great space for our team and families to gather. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Ayres during JO 2021.
Summary: Stayed at Laguna Woods location in 2019 and this visit at Mission Viejo. Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, blackout curtains and cool AC. Great onsite restaurant and plenty of nearby food options less than 5 minutes away. Easy parking, clean pool area. Thank you Ayres! You made our team stay easy so we could on the Games.

Pet friendly, clean , updated ( remodeled)  comfortable beds , friendly staff.  I have booked 3 more stays this summer . For the money you can’t go wrong. I have recommended this hotel to several people for long term stay.

We loved this hotel. It was really nice. Our room was a one bedroom suite. The bed was super comfortable with good pillows. Nice pool. Good breakfast, that was included in the price. Very nice staff. Definitely Will stay here again.

My wife daughter and I just finished a months-long extended stay at this hotel. We're on the road a lot, and this was one of the best hotel experiences we've had. The hotel, recently remodeled, is spotless and very comfortable. The breakfast is excellent and the pool and spa are very well maintained a real delight. The best thing about this hotel is the people who work here who are all very friendly, attentive, helpful. That took an excellent stay into an entirely new league. Kudos Ayers MV!

Summary Heading: The Only Place to Stay in Mission Viejo
Summary: An Amazing Stay As Usual.  Ayres Suites Mission Viejo is our favorite hotel in southern California.  The rooms are large and very comfortable and everything in them is brand new. The staff was attentive to all our needs and very friendly.  The rooms, hallways, breakfast area were spotless and we felt very safe with the way they handle Covid related issues. The pool is a great way to relax and was also very clean.  Miguel always handles the included breakfast efficiently and can handle any size crowd to make it a pleasure.  We will be returning soon, looking forward to seeing the staff again.  Thank you for making us feel at home.
Manager Response: Dear Ken W,   Thank you for staying with us at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo and taking the time to write a review! We are thrilled to see that we are your chosen hotel in Southern California and you had exceptional experiences with us. Our priority is to provide the most comfortable stays for our valued guests and look forward to welcoming you back to your home away from home soon.   Sincerely,  Steve Wheatley General Manager

Summary Heading: Large and comfortable rooms. Super friendly staff
Summary: My family stayed here for about 4 weeks in order to spend the holidays with family and house hunt. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The outdoor pool was a huge hit with my kids! The hotel also allows pets for a small fee. There is a large park within walking distance (1/2 mile) over the 241: Altisima Park. The hotel is conveniently located to shopping and Lake Mission Viejo. Parking is free and there are charging stations for electric vehicles. My only complaint is that the beds are not that comfortable but the rooms and the shared areas of the hotel are very clean and well decorated. And all the rooms come with ceiling fans and the AC works! The fitness room is small with limited choice but I spent more time walking and running

Stayed 1 night at Ayres last week. Had to  cancel other 4 days because the Masks rules were not being enforced. The front desk people did not seem to notice or comment on so many people walking around with no mask on. There were people in hallways, elevators and lobby with no mask. About 30%-40% not wearing mask. The hotel had nice rooms and was clean.  We will not be returning.

This is our second time staying here. The rooms have been updated very nicely, the pool is great and breakfast was a plus...I was happy to see all COVID protocols were in place and taken seriously. The hotel and rooms were super clean. The refrigerator didn’t work but none the less, my family and I had a comfortable stay here!

Very nice, quiet and clean.  We slept so well and appreciate the costumer service and care.  We staid here during Thanksgiving.  My sister lives just 5 minutes away so it was a nice escape from all the craziness to be able to go to our hotel room at night.

The room is enough big, clean, all stuff included. Location is good, near the 241 freeway but not noisy. The pool is clean and nice. Free fast Wifi and free parking free breakfast. There is a laundry inside the hotel. All hotel employees are polite and friendly. So everything is perfect. Thank you so much Ayres Hotel, Lake Forest

The room was perfect, the amenities were great, the location is perfect to visit the lake, loved the interior design and all the vintage family photos too. I highly recommend staying here. There are 2 separate wings with a beauty spa and bar and grill that will add to the experience.

I booked joining rooms for my daughter's 10th birthday at the Spa location and got there with two rooms that both had King sized beds. Not really conducive for a slumber party so we had to move to the sister hotel which is quite older. The room configuration was better but it was pretty dated. I promised my daughter and her friends a dip in the pool only to get there and the heater was broken. So they swam and froze. The stay was nice and the breakfast was great. Not sure I'll be booking again but it was fine for a 1-night stay.
When me and family checked in Chandler checked me in was very pleasant. The check out was just as pleasant and made sure I had water for the road. Thank you Chandler 👍🏾the was comfortable and clean.

My family & I had a quick 1 night stay at Ayres Suites coming from AZ while on our way to San Diego. William checked me in while Chandler checked my mother in. My mother asked for room near each while I joked and said separate us. We both wanted rooms on the 3rd floor so both gentleman made sure we both got what we wanted. Lol! They put us both on the 3rd floor but far enough apart to give me my space. Lol! We all had a good laugh. Great check in!! Chandler also handled our check out. It was quick, easy and he gave us bottled water for the road. Way to secure return customers. We’ll definitely be back if ever in the area. Great job gentlemen.

The pictures are accurate  Very clean and breakfast and evening meal is exactly what you want for this price.  Staff is super Professional and polite.  The rooms are spacious and clean, the cable box is pretty complete too.  Bang for buck it’s a no brainer

Our nearby home in Palmia was being remodeled, so we booked three nights at the Ayres Suites, which is where our adult children and grandchildren have stayed in the past.   The hotel is like a boutique hotel, well decorated, and welcoming.  Our room was spacious and clean and the staff was attentive.   Breakfasts are outstanding and food is abundant.   Reasonable prices.

I have stayed at Ayres suites in mission Viejo on and off for work just a little over 4 years. I have always been greeted with a smile, a joke, a hand shake and an overall friendly experience every time I have stayed there. I have seen staff come and go at this hotel and not one time have I had a bad experience with any of the staff members.

We chose this hotel for location. Everything was great. The service from check in to the man who made our breakfast and everyone in between. The room was large and everything was clean and very nice. We had a small fridge and drink area (coffee etc) we used this fridge a lot. The hotel restaurant on our first afternoon we went there for a quick drink and ended up with dinner. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The food was very good as well. I had the pastrami tacos - yes you read that right. Try 'em and you'll see. Because we were there to spend time with family we know we'll be back and stay right here again!

We come to Mission Viejo every year for the FTT conference and also have our Global Leadership Team meeting before it. The Ayres Suites Mission Viejo is convenient and comfortable for our meetings. The staff are very helpful.

We stay at the Ayers Suites often when we visit family. The hotel is 2.2 miles from our daughter and offers better amenities than the Marriott which is also close.  The staff always has a smile on their face and seem ready to help.   The breakfast and evening happy hour with free wine and snacks is a pleasant treat.  Miguel and Sylvia always go out if their way to make sure I can find my favorite flavor yogurt for breakfast.

Highly recommend this hotel to any business or pleasure travelers. The customer service is incredible. The hotel is clean, comfortable and safe. I book travel for our company all over the United States and they are the by far the best hotel we have done business with over the years.

You have 2 building of this hotel and they aren't the same. My building had no electricity Sunday morning and the sink backed up. The other building had no issues what so ever. One building free breakfast was minor while the other building had made to order meals-not the same but paying the same price. Overall-no so great

Summary Heading: Be careful with a receptionist - wake up call story
Summary: I wanted to reemphasize how much depends on people during one night the receptionist was excellent - funny, open, caring. I asked him for a wake up call and was watching him interacting with other guests - he was good. and on the second morning when I had to go to the airport I understood that noone gave me a wake up call!! I went to the reception, saw another guy and asking him what happened to my wake up call.  he said that he forgot to check the wake up call list!. can you imagine - I almost overslept because someone did not check a wake up call list.

Clean and comfortable rooms, lovely pool and hot tub outside, quiet for sleeping, fantastic personnel, very accomodating, fantastic breakfast and light dinner meals, etc.  Nothing but excellent service at a good price.  COME AND SEE FOR YOURSELF.  Dorothy

Ayres hotels are hands-down favorites when visiting California! The Mission Viejo suites are next door to another, more upscale Ayres property (that has a restaurant, spa, etc.), but this one has the traditional Ayres layout. It's in a quiet location up in the hills, next to the toll highway, but away from I-5. Shares pool with the other property. Has all the excellent Ayres features, including breakfast, afternoon cookies and happy hour, super comfy beds, and luxurious bathtubs.  We were especially impressed with the service at the front desk during our stay, very helpful with any questions or requests! They take commitment to service seriously!

Rooms are big and spacious. Bed is very comfortable and aircons works very well. Room was quiet and nice and dark. So slept very well. Breakfast was the only let down. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

After a couple of hiccups checking in, I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Luxurious, Old-World Opulence and attention to detail from green-marbled floors in bathroom to velvet bedroom curtains and bergundy-gold carpets in lobby and hallways. Everything looked new, even the leather couch in my room. Elevators are super-fast. Spacious, quiet room, small but modern bathroom. Separate bar area in room. LOVED the high ceilings--made the room feel spacious and larger. Excellent water pressure. Amenities were satisfactory. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Linens, curtains and carpets were exceptionally clean(I have a UV flashlight). Generous standard American breakfast with the best bacon I have ever tasted. Room Service food from adjacent restaurant was good. Plenty of free

Summary Heading: Beautiful facility, very helpful and professional staff, very good pricing
Summary: The rooms were clean upon arrival and were well maintained during our stay, they were well appointed and had all the expected amenities: microwaves, refrigerators, coffee makers etc. Parking was very convenient. The full breakfast was exceptional as were the happy hours from Monday through Thursdays! All in all, this hotel was wonderful and we will be staying at Ayers properties again.

Room size was great, location is good, but the carpets and the lobby and room furniture need to be steam clean, probably since a few years back.  The staff is great and courteous.  Plenty of well lite parking.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in great location - Good value for the money !
Summary: I was here for 5  nights attending a diving meet at Mission Viejo.  The motel is well located with a beautiful outdoor pool.  It is well maintained - albeit a bit dated.  Rooms were spacious and clean - with refrigerators and coffee makers.  Towels were new and thick - and room had both hair dryer and ironing board.  Room decor was dated - but I enjoyed my stay.  Bed was comfy and sheets and linens were good quality.  Air conditioning controls were a little wonky - but I was happy overall.  Happy Hour downstairs every weeknight was a nice touch.  Beer/Wine and heavy hor'doerves were a nice surprise.  I'd definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Large rooms, great front desk, but...
Summary: Beautiful lobby with friendly, professional people.  Decor old world charm.  We stayed on the suites side, not the spa hotel on the other side.  Our room was large, but dimly lit.  Found it hard for both of us to get ready in the morning.  Not enough light to put on makeup.  Small soaps!  Sometimes, when we took two showers in one day we ran out of soap.  Air conditioning in room while very efficient, was very loud while sleeping!  Room were very traditional and old world.  Complimentary breakfast room definitely needed an upgrade, and the food was not good.  We went to the spa side of the property, where the room had a much more inviting atmosphere, and the food was also better...more choices...they actually made eggs, and offered hard boiled eggs.  A much better atmosphere.

Summary Heading: Customer service was amazing!  Bed was super comfortable.
Summary: My coworker and I arrived a little early to check in and there was an issue with our check in (our agency’s issue, not the hotel’s), the staff, especially Conner and the manager, was so helpful and went above and beyond to help us solve the issue and get into our rooms so we could rest.  The rooms were very nice and the bed was super comfortable.  I had probably some of the best sleep I’ve ever had in a hotel during that week.  Everyone was super friendly and helpful.  Conner gave us great suggestions for restaurants every time we asked.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I wish every hotel was as friendly as Ayres Suites.

Summary Heading: A hotel with character and great breakfast/happy hour
Summary: The Ayers has a great breakfast and a weekday happy hour with food.  Since we were there for a Sunday swim meet that began with 6am warmups, the hotel opened the breakfast an hour earlier on Sunday to accommodate the swimming guests.  This was greatly appreciated and I've not been at a hotel that was that accommodating to it's guests.  The decor was very traditional.  The beds were very comfortable.  I would stay there again.

This is my third trip, once a year, and it is always the same.  Great service from the free breakfast ( and available early), housekeeping and extra snacks at 5 p.m.  I have never had an issue with anything.  Love the pool available at any time as this is always relaxing after a long day.  Would recommend to families too.  Close to all kinds of food, attractions and Starbucks too. Plus I love having all the pillows on a comfy bed.

Summary Heading: A great place for wheelchair-bound guests
Summary: We pulled into the Mission Viejo Ayres Hotel at 11pm after a long road trip, and found that the phone reservationist (outsourced) had made an error and booked me into a room that was wheelchair accessible but with a bathtub, not roll-in shower.  We discovered this only after arriving in the room in the newer building, which was nicely appointed with an ample accessible desk/table at the entry.  I actually could not reach the room phone because the bed was too close to the wardrobe (an accessibility issue easily solved by pushing the bed 3 inches towards the other wall), so my daughter had to retrieve the phone for me and unroll the cord a bit.  When I rang the lobby, Jackie was very apologetic. Thankfully, she found a room with roll-in shower in the other building, and she came

Behind the desk staff: friendly, helpful and efficient. Rooms clean, beds comfortable and quiet. Breakfast room opens promptly on time and always a good breakfast. Breakfast room staff very helpful and the room holds many people.

This was the second time we stayed at a Ayres property in the last 4 months. My wife and i will always try to stay with Ayres whenever possible. The properties are not only nice and clean, they have a luxurious feel. With a value price. The breakfast in the morning and food at happy hour in the evening sets them apart and add a tremendous value.

Summary Heading: I don’t even know where to start.
Summary: Dated hotel, a mix of very nice staff people and very rude people. Very loud, as in LOUD air conditioner, the positive side of that is no one heard gramma snore. The bed was a little bit bouncy, and soft.  “ Dear Ayers executives, that is a huge disadvantage as many hotels are investing in comfortable beds”  Other than that, the breakfast was pretty good, and while bedding was worn and pillows were hard, at least they seemed pretty clean.
Manager Response: Dear WeMnMs,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience and it is apparent, in this case, that we fell short of that commitment. While I wish you had a better experience, the feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. Rest assured that the concerns you have shared will not go unnoticed and we will strive to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The customer service was excellent. Conner was one of the managers that helped me with making sure we had a room that lead straight outside for the service dogs. In the morning they provide breakfast that worked out so good because I did not have time to go out and get due to training was right next door. Loved all of the staff here. I will make sure next time when I am in Orange county all stay there again. Thanks
Manager Response: Dear Sherrie R,  Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful experience with us! It is delightful to see that you had a wonderful time at our hotel and enjoyed the attentive service our team strives to offer. Your kind words regarding our complimentary full American breakfast and our outstanding service are greatly appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional stay!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The service at breakfast was disappointing. We were there for three days.  The cook/worker was not willing to cook or serve in any way. Just rushed us through the line wiping down and cleaning his back area the whole time. He did not want anyone to come for breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Sjvh,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience and it is apparent in this case that we fell short of that commitment. While I wish you had a better experience, the feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. Rest assured that the concerns you have shared regarding our breakfast team will not go unnoticed and will be utilized as a learning opportunity. Thank again for your feedback, I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Our room was excellent. Clean, large, and secure. The beauty of the hallways, lobby, sitting, area are unmatched. This hotel also offers a free, full breakfast. Not just a few stale muffins and old fruit. The breakfast is eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, coffee, cereal, milk, juice, etc. The location is perfect because the Toll Roads are within a quarter mile. Take the 241 north for about a mile, and your at shopping, eating, theatre, and a great church. Drive a few miles more, and you connect with the 133 to the beaches The customer service is unsurpassed due to the entire staff are professional and welcoming. Anytime my family has our summer vacation, this is the hotel we use. A person just cannot do better. Special shout out to Mr. Dean Birtles for consistently leading his staff

Just stayed here. Very nicely appointed hotel with spacious rooms. In quiet location with nice pool overlooking Saddleback Valley. Free hot breakfast but my eggs were cold. Could improve the breakfast.

Horrible visit! Never staying here again . Looks nice on the outside but on the inside needs some updates .  My wife was getting ready and the power went out for 45 minutes? Anyhow power returned, looking in the mirror and I couldn’t believe my eyes a cockroach crawling on  closet wall behind me . We immediately grabbed our bags and began shaking them out checking for more . They say they come out at dark ! We called down to speak to manager,  didn’t really seem to shocked. He then sent an employee to our room to check , sure enough another roach was crawling on the floor .  We was utterly discussed. Employee squashed it on the floor OMG!! There was also what appears to be a blood stain on dust ruffle of bed ! “Enough” time to check out!! We had a long stay booked as well . But

Wonderful location to beach and relaxation.  Does have spa.  Limited food menu in bar. But large choice of beer, wine and cocktails.  Did not have chance to utilize athena spa. About 45 minutes to disneyland and universal studios

Summary Heading: Best hotel experience I have ever had!
Summary: I am staying here long-term for work until I formally relocate to the area. Everyone, and I mean everyone on this property demonstrates true customer service!  I travel the world for work and have stayed in dozens of hotels...this by far exceeds them all...from the check-in experience, check-out experience, accommodations and amenities offered for their guests. The location is great, close to many entertaining things you can think of (Irvine Spectrum is my favorite!). The property is very warm and feels so much like home.  Nice and quiet...no kids running up and down the halls. Many places to hike and walk too if that is your pleasure!
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer S,  We sincerely appreciate the detailed review! Our team is devoted to exceeding your expectations and we are thrilled to see that we did just that during your stay. Your compliments regarding our team members, our optimal location, and the accommodations we offer are truly appreciated.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for business or pleasure
Summary: The hotel is excellent.  It is clean, the staff is helpful and friendly.  The afternoon salad, nacho bar with beer and wine is well received.  The room breakfast is great.  The hotel is quiet and well maintained.  It is an excellent place to relax or stay while on business.
Manager Response: Dear Connie W,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. Your compliments regarding our premium amenities and comfortable accommodations are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your candid feedback, we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Outdated, not the cleanest and over priced
Summary: Between the rooms being very outdated, basic basic cable, 19 inch tv, food was really bad, even from next door. Never saw a place add a room service fee, then delivery, then 20% gratuity. They do the bare minimum to freshen up rooms. Pool is not heated. They ran out of food 3 out of 5 nights.  The shuttle is the nicest part of the hotel.  Would not return
Manager Response: Dear Ian M,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it is apparent in this case that we fell short of that commitment. While I wish you had a better experience, the feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. Rest assured that the concerns you have shared will not go unnoticed and we will strive to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank again for your feedback, I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with good location and amenities
Summary: We have stayed at several other Ayres Hotels in southern CA so were very glad there was an Ayres Hotel near the location of our daughters wedding. We made arrangements with Jennifer for a block of rooms for many out of town guests and even some southern CA guests to stay at the hotel. Our guests were very impressed with the quality of the rooms, the included breakfast, the heated swimming pool, and the happy hour on one of the nights. The staff were very helpful to us and our wedding guests. It made for a wonderful celebration and family reunions too.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, tucked away in the hills
Summary: Was pleasantly surprised at how tastefully done are the rooms and common areas of this hotel.  We expected just a "run of the mill" place, but were pleased with how it felt much more "high end".  Every single staff member we encountered was friendly & professional; the continental breakfast was way better than most any other continental breakfast (and having traveled a lot on business, I've had to endure too many really bad breakfasts!).  Other than the fact that they don't have iced tea, so I had to make my own, no complaints.

Stayed 4 nights here and had no issues with the hotel.  They have a complimentary breakfast and also an evening reception (free beer and food until it runs out).  Rooms are clean. Hotel location is in a fairly quiet area.

We always stay here when visiting our grandkids and it has become our home away from home.  The rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable, the included breakfast is wonderful, and the staff are friendly and helpful!  Love everything about it!
Manager Response: Dear Candy E,  Thank you so much for your candid feedback! I am thrilled to know that you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. Your loyalty, as well as your compliments regarding our comfortable accommodations, complimentary full breakfast, and attentive team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotels, I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Closet was large, along with a nice vanity area.  I would add some support in the bathrooms for those have balance issues, that made it difficult to navigate.    Breakfast was nice, and full dinner Monday-Thursday. There is a little confusion between the two hotels, one is Ayres Hotel and Spa and Ayres Suites.  Places to eat were a little far away, but being familiar with the area made it not much of an issue.  Would stay again.

I've been staying at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo since about April about every other week.(2018, apr-jul)  It's a good hotel; clean quiet, nice amenities, right off the 241 toll road (easy to get to).  They have a fantastic complimentary breakfast, everything made fresh ( no microwaved eggs or meat).  The staff is always accommodating and willing to help with requests.  They make it easy to keep booking there, and not look around for other hotels.

I've traveled alot and stayed in many hotels; my standards are high.  This hotel checked all the boxes: friendly staff (front desk, food service, maid service); clean rooms; beds amazingly comfortable with plenty of pillows; quiet-especially at night; complimentary breakfast was really good and coffee is available all day!   I don't have anything bad to say about this place.  Only wish I had time to take advantage of the Spa and Bar in their hotel next door. I definitely recommend this place - especially for picky travelers with high standards, like me!

Reasonable breakfast being served everyday as well as some snacks in the evening. The only minimal issue are the AC’s that are very noisy. Overall I would recommend this place specially if you get a good deal.

Great location , very clean and well appointed rooms. The pool is shared by both and was busy mostly families having fun with nice views. Also have a jacuzzi there and courtesy towels. The hot was the free breakfast from 7-10 each morning, well done thank you. The parking was always available not a hassle as can sometimes be the case. We also enjoyed gathering  at the fire pit in the courtyard of the hotel spa .please note the resturant in spa hotel called the old camp bar & grill was fun & makayla very kind & professional server. Thanks Ayres highly recommended. ( FYI my pics not uploading from iPhone)

The breakfast is excellent, but they have too few metal utensils, so unless you are early, you must use plastic ones.  They make pancakes, but give you cheap sweet sauce.  For so little, could have been great.

This was our first time staying at this location and unfortunately it did not go as smoothly as planned.   The first issue was there was no water when we checked in to our room. Not a great start to our stay when we had two children who needed to shower. The water came back on within the hour, but there was no hot water at all until about 6:30-7PM. Also, the bathtub in our room was filled with water when we first went into our room. We had to inform housekeeping who had to come
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your candid review. Firstly, we would like to apologize for the inconveniences that you faced with your room throughout your stay. The issues with the hot water, lack of water, and malfunctioning television has been addressed to our team members. Your feedback is very important to us so that we are aware of the corrections that are needed in our hotel in order to provide the exceptional service that we are known for. Nevertheless, we are glad to hear that you were able to enjoy the other hotel accommodations and amenities that we have to offer here at our hotel. Again, we apologize and we hope you allow us another chance to welcome you back for a more pleasant stay.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Very comfortable hotel.  Beautiful room and great breakfast.  A lot of variety for breakfast including scrambled eggs, or cooked the way you want them, pancakes, sausage, bacon, cereals, great coffee, juices, fruits, etc.

Summary Heading: Like coming home after a long day of work
Summary: Stayed her for the 7th time and it is always like coming home after a long day of work. Rooms are clean and offer a lot of comfort. Staff is very friendly. Hotel is conveniently located, close to the highway (toll road) but without any noise from traffic and some good restaurants like Picolini's and Shabu Shabu
Manager Response: Dear Robert R,  We appreciate you taking the time to give us a star rating. Knowing that we are able to provide a relaxing and welcoming environment for you after a long day is quite gratifying. The kind words about our team members and recommendations are most appreciated. We hope to welcome you back soon for another relaxing stay.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location but not a great hotel. Not recommended. Front desk staff was not helpful at all.
Summary: Not a great hotel. Not worth the money they charge. Elevators are in the corner of the hotel and very far from the rooms on the other hand. My mom has arthritis and it was very difficult for her walk all the way to the elevators. Front desk people were young girls who seem like they were not interested in working there and not paying attention to customers.   A lot of guests were smoking at the front entrance of the hotel and the front desk staff was not asking them to move 20 feet away from the entrance or the building.   Pool was decent but detached from the hotel building so you had to cross the parking driveway to enter the pool area. Small but there was hardly anyone so it was okay. Pool was clean.  Parking was getting full very quickly at night and had to park at the end
Manager Response: Dear Mr. AK,  Thank you for your kind insight into your recent stay. I regret to see that your stay did not meet your expectations. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconveniences that you faced throughout your stay from the service at the desk to the distance from your room to the elevators. We have addressed your concerns with our team members and we are currently working on making corrections wherever necessary. We hope you allow us the opportunity to welcome you back for a much more enjoyable stay.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Lovely staff were helpful from initial reservation through our weekend stay. Nice clean hotel rooms and Good breakfast.  We had seventeen people in the Tuscany room, which works well for weekend scrapbook retreat.

The hotel is outstanding, the staff very gracious.  Was there for a week for family issues and felt almost like I was home.  The only negative comments would be that the beds could be upgraded.  Other than that I would definitely recommend this hotel.  The location to the toll roads is also excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Bobbie W,  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to give us a star rating and for sharing your experience with us. Nothing thrills us more than to hear that you had a pleasant time at our hotel. We thank you kindly for the warm compliments and recommendations about our hotel and team members. We strive to provide exceptional hospitality for all of our valued guests. We have addressed your feedback about the beds to our team members and are working on making corrections where they are needed. We look forward to having you back for an even better experience.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: $120 per night. close to the toll road highway. odd location on the edge of smaller city.  at least free parking. simple lobby - no snacks or drinks.old simple but huge room.  cheap pillows. cheaper sheets. breakfast was typical ok.  small TV didn't work and front desk asked me to try and fix MYSELF !  BS. adjacent hotel is same owner but separate - odd.  they have beer/wine and snacks but cannot charge to room -but i was told you could but then they changed their mind. hot water comes and goes.  typical of old cheaper hotels but this was mid-priced Courtyard near by is more dependable.
Manager Response: Dear TSNNTY,  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. We are so sorry to read that your stay was anything less than exceptional. Please know that your comments and feedback are quite valuable to us and they are being utilized in order to improve our various services. We have addressed your concerns with our hotel and team members and will do everything we can to ensure our guests experience nothing less than an extraordinary stay. Thank you again for your valuable feedback and we hope that you allow us another opportunity to welcome you back for a much more enjoyable experience.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This hotel is great.  I stay here at least one week every month.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable.  The breakfast is very good, hot eggs and bacon and sausage (not just a continental breakfast with waffles like you get at so many other places).  The staff at this hotel is exceptional and goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable.  I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in the Mission Viejo area.
Manager Response: Dear johnk0923,  Thank you for the taking the time to share your recent experience with us. The warm compliments and recommendations you have shared with fellow travelers about our complimentary breakfast, excellent service, as well as our well-appointed room accommodations are greatly appreciated. It thrills us to know that you enjoyed everything about your stay and hope you will join us again soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel for a Quick Stay
Summary: Stayed one night with a family of 3 for an event in UC Irvine. Hotel is right off Freeway and parking is free. Nothing in the immediate area except a strip mall across the Freeway and you need to drive to get to places. Free wifi is included.   Just a bit above the standard hotel room (includes sofa bed and kitchenette), however the hotel provides a free breakfast.  The free breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea, juices and milk. Much better than the standard free continental breakfast offerings at other hotels. This was a great way to start the day.  A pool area with hot tub overlooks the valley.   Overall, an ok place to stay for a quick stop in the Orange County Area if you can get a good price, however if you are
Manager Response: Dear Donavan,  Thank you greatly for taking the time to share your experience with us. We value your feedback as we will certainly use this as a training platform to make adjustments wherever necessary. We are happy to see that you were satisfied with your stay and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family and business
Summary: The rooms were clean and spacious and the breakfast buffet was wonderful. Easy access to all major venues in Mission Viejo. This hotel does its best to accommodate all your needs! I highly recommend  this place
Manager Response: Dear Larry Y,  We truly appreciate you taking the time to rate us following your recent visit to Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. It is delightful to know that we were able to provide you with a wonderful experience. We look forward to having you back soon for another unforgettable experience.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Needed to stay for my daughters gymnastics competition.
Summary: Very nice and clean.  Loved the pool area, just wish we had time to play in it, awesome view.  Everything went smooth, very nice and customer service was nice also. Will definitely stay again if we need too, very pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear Renne,  Thank you so much for your kind compliments and recommendations. We are thrilled to see that we were able to provide a comfortable stay during your daughter's gymnastics competition. We look forward to welcoming you back for another wonderful stay here at the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Really impressed with this hotel.  We did a two night stay on business and it was great.  Breakfast is really good.  Service was great!  I did not have a chance to try the pool due to schedule but the view is really good.  Looked pretty neat.

This hotel was wonderful!  It was sparkling clean, had a wonderful staff and the breakfast was great. The pool was was very nice and large. There is plenty of free parking. You can not go wrong with Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo.

This hotel was perfect for my visit with family.  Hotel was clean, comfortable and clean room, friendly staff, free Breakfast (which was Great), free parking (well lighted), free Wi-Fi.  Will definitely stay here again!

Sits right in the heart of Orange County on Los Alisos.  A stone's throw from the 241 and RSM.  Free breakfast, not the continental breakfast either. It also has a nice bar for the grown & sexy.  I had a very nice and spacious room.  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear ReggieT6425,  Thank you for your wonderful feedback and rating. We hope we are able to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable experience!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The hotel was quaint. European boutique style. The staff was amazing! Always willing ti help out when we needed. When we asked for items they were willing and able to help us out. The Tuscany room was spacious and we had an outside area to sit as well. The hotel was decorated for the Christmas holiday. The tree was beautifully decorated. We loved taking pictures by the tree and the fire place. It sets on the out skirts of town, but easy enough to get to. We enjoyed our time at the hotel!

We stayed here for our wedding night, and could not have been happier with the service we received. We came in late from the bars after our reception and the front desk associate already had our key out and ready for us. We were upgraded to a suite with jet tub bath! It was incredible! We will definitely be staying again!
Manager Response: Dear Bree D,  Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review. I am delighted to know that you enjoyed your memorable occasion at our hotel. It is an honor to be included in your special moment and hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon! Congratulations on your nuptials. We look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Very clean hotel very friendly staff. Great breakfast and happy hour. Will stay again. Close to freeways and lots of things to do in the area.  The onsite bar and grill was very good. Shopping and entertainment is very accessible.  If you bike ride there are lots of trails near hotel to enjoy

Easy access to hotel, good size room, comfortable bed.  The hotel decor feels a bit outdated but it is nice!  Great price and the breakfast hit the spot.  The pool and jacuzzi were nice.  The staff was friendly, parking was easy.
Manager Response: Dear Adrianne D.,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with this review! We are glad to see that you enjoyed a pleasant experience with us and we hope you decide to stay with us again during your next visit to the area.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay.  Close to the freeway.  Clean spacious rooms.
Summary: I was there for my Son's wedding,  We reserved a block of rooms.  The service was excellent from start to finish. The rooms were great with fridge and Microwave  The only negative was $4.00 for a bottle of water.  Great hot breakfast imclded.
Manager Response: Dear vegaslady10,  Thank you for your positive review! We are happy to see that we were able to provide you with a wonderful stay and we look forward to having you as our guest again soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This Hotel is great and the staff is excellent, I travel to the OC every week and stay here two nights a week, I cannot say enough about the staff, form the front desk to housekeeping everyone treats you like family and that is nice when you are away from yours. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the lobby has a nice fireplace and the decor tells a story about the family that founded the chain. I like the breakfast as its better than most and the evening Apps wth Beer and Wine is great,

For a freeway adjacent hotel, this was better than expected. They really did the lobby up with a fireplace and dark wood and bowls of fruit - so its a good first impression. The rooms were pretty generic, maybe a little worn around the edges and dated. The fridge in our room didnt keep things cold so we had to constantly put bags of ice in it so it would work. Pool area was fine - nothing fancy but did the trick. Breakfast was decent (though wish they had more allergy friendly options..)

The property was clean but dated. The staff was very nice, Breakfast was typical for hotel included. Our room was comfortable and clean. Lobby has plenty of space to hang out and Catch up with friends and family.
Manager Response: Dear mandltaylor4,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback following your most recent stay. I am glad to read that you found your experience with us to be pleasant. We hope you decide to stay with us again during your next visit to the area.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This chain is much nicer and upscale than the typcial mid prices hotel chain.  Prices are similar - but you get a much nicer room, breakfast, evening appetizers with beer and wine/  No brainer!  Too bad there aren't more of them!
Manager Response: Dear annette c,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with this wonderful review! We are delighted to see that you enjoyed a great stay and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: My wife and I recently came over from the UK and stayed for six nights at the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. We were overwhelmed by everything about the hotel. The staff were professional and friendly. The front desk were always ready to help. The kitchen staff were more than happy to prepare dishes made to order at breakfast and the coffee was very good. The housekeeping always left the room in an immaculate state each day. The room was spacious and the bed was one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept in. The hotel was very affordable and we will most definitely be coming back. Anybody needing to stay in the Rancho Santa Margarita area for business or pleasure should put this hotel at the top of their list!

Accommodations were comfortable. I particularly like the lobby.   The breakfast in the morning was very tasty. Better than most places we have been to that provide a breakfast. There was one issue I had was that they provided no strawberry jam for my English muffins. They have marmalade and a mixed jelly. When I did ask that came up with one packet strawberry jam.   Parking was plentiful and convenient.  The location of the hotel for us was quite strategic to the locations with in Mission Viejo we needed to be.  Not far from the airport.

This hotel always rates a 10+ score in our books! EVERYTHING is done professionally -- desk staff are kind, knowledgeable, friendly. Housekeeping is thorough and considerate. All of the extra perks of fresh apples, yummy cookies, breakfast, AND dinner several nights during the week continue to keep this hotel at the top of our list for Orange County visits.This Ayres Suites is an unbeatable property and we highly, enthusiastically, and consistently recommend this hotel as a top pick for hotel accommodations in this area of Orange County.

Was not expecting such a nice stay. The grounds are on a hill surrounded by vistas and mountains, mature trees, nice pool and jacuzzi, comfortable pool side tables and chairs. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the interior of the place is well thought out and welcoming. The breakfast is a real breakfast for free, and the two people running it will cook made to order eggs and pancakes and otherwise stock the buffet. The deserve the tips a few of us put in the jar. Coffee was decent, far superior to hotel coffee in general. The staff were very accommodating and really seemed to have everyone's enjoyment at heart. Lastly, the price is way low compared to the quality, a great value.

This was such a nice hotel. The front desk staff were very accommodating and the room was the nicest, most comfortable room we have ever stayed in! The Mission Viejo area is beautiful and we had a great "stay-cation"! This will be our new favorite for weekend get-aways!

Summary Heading: Needs full service restaurant & bar during day time hours!!
Summary: reasonably priced, needs food & bar service ALL DAY or get a Kiosk to handle those services. One front desk lady had no personality and very rudy (dark brunette)  if you have an option not to get the breakfast - don't bother - eggs were good but sausage & hash browns unedible
Manager Response: Dear Jeff Z,  Thank you kindly for your feedback. Unfortunately, we do not own the restaurant on site. We simply lease the space and therefore, we are unable to dictate how restaurant management should operate. Nevertheless, we will certainly share your suggestions. I do regret to see that our complimentary breakfast fell short of your expectations. Additionally, please accept my sincere apologies with regards to the lack of service our team member provided. Rest assured that improvements will be made wherever necessary.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Short stay while our house was flooded
Summary: I did not expect to need a hotel so finding this one in my city was a treat.  I was fortunate to get the room on Hotwire so the price was right.  We were in the 3rd floor.  The room was charming with plenty of room and nice amenities. The best part was that just down the hall was two pay to wash laundry machines for my overflowing laundry.  (Due to house flood.)The laundry room was nice and clean with detergent for sale and seating.  This made my job much more comfortable.   We are breakfast in the mornings we were there and they always had hot American breakfast items available. The coffee was good. I truly enjoyed my stay.  I definitely recommend this property.  Thank you Ayres!

We stay here about 4 times each year and will continue to return anytime we are in Mission Viejo visiting family. The rooms are large with couch, a refrigerator, microwave and are always spotless, The staff is the best, always welcoming us back.  The included breakfast is a cost saver and Miguel runs it very efficiently and can handle any number of guests. The lobby always has a snack and drink for its guests, The pool is a great place to relax. The free WiFi is a great benefit.We love this hotel, you can't go wrong.  Thank you Dean and the staff for another perfect stay. We highly recommend it.

The Ayers Suites Mission Viejo staff define what customer service truly is. As we are all aware, customer service in this society has woefully declined over the years. Not at Ayers Suites Mission Viejo. My family loves to walk in to Ayer's beautiful lobby and receive the welcoming smiles coming from the staff. Check-in is painless and comfortable. The rooms are awesome, complete with powerful Wi-FI. Housekeeping staff provide a"Can do" attitude, and the free FULL breakfast is genuinely good! And again, the staff in charge of serving the food are pleasant and helpful. There is simply no other choice for my family than Ayers Suites Mission Viejo. My only regret is Ayers Suites Hotels are not everywhere. If they were, all of the places I travel to would include Ayers. Thank you

We come to Mission Viejo every summer. When we found this place, it's my "go to" place. Wonderful accommodations, wonderful staff. Great breakfast and light dinner provided, at no extra cost. Nice pool and spa. On site coin laundry and exercise room. You won't be sorry.

Summary Heading: Wish all Hotels were as good.
Summary: Rooms are clean and spacious. Staff is friendly and professional. Great breakfast each morning.  Great pool and hot tub.  Bar right next door but restaurant closed early. Will stay there whenever I am in this area.

I go to this hotel on a regular basis for work. It's comfortable, and the staff are always pleasant and accommodating. They offer a social happy hour which is nice as well.   While the breakfast is included in the price, it would be nice if the hot breakfast options were changed periodically. As a business traveler, it can be tough choosing the same thing every morning for 4-5 days.   Lastly, make sure you have a car as you definitely have to drive to get to any decent shopping, restaurants etc.

Everyone nice and friendly.. room clean but linens not changed over a 5 night stay; bedskirt looked like someone balled it up and slept on it for a week... everything looking crumpled.  Again, very friendly people but not sure there's attention to detail.  Maid forgot to leave shampoo and lotions.  I think it was very expensive for the amenities.  Breakfast was nothing special...food and disorganized cafeteria-style line.

We chose this hotel for its convenient location to explore Orange County and LA.  The room was spacious and cool, the bed and linens comfortable and the general impression of the hotel was clean and well taken care of. The decor is a bit on the darker side but that seems to be by choice and the style of this particular property. Our only interaction with staff was during the check-in which was quick and friendly. Unfortunately, one of us woke up with unexplained bite marks every morning during our stay. Everything appeared clean and we weren't able to find any traces of bugs and insects but it did make our experience a little less enjoyable.

Clean, professionally staffed facility. Ample room in the breakfast & common areas. wonderful pool & outdoor area. Close to restaraunts, shopping,... Good uber service locally.Rooms are large and well thought out with all the amenities needed
Manager Response: Dear debmeyers22,  Thank you so much for your candid feedback. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the attentive service our team provided as well as the accommodations we offer. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The facility is decent.  Moderately priced and reasonably well kept. Ideally located for my business visit.  Family friendly place too.  When I checked in I was stunned by how rude the receptionist was.  She may be the only reason I won't stay here again next time.

Every time we come here the staff is so welcoming and remember our names.  The property is maintained very well and the rooms are always so clean and beds are so comfortable.  This is a hidden gem!  Close to all Southern California amenities and only a short 15 minute drive to Laguna Beach via the Toll Road.

As always we had a perfect stay.  The staff is great, always looking to make sure we have everything we need. The mattress is the best of any place we have ever stayed.  Rooms are large and very well equipped and as always spotless and well maintained. The included breakfast hits the spot.  We will be back shortly.
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth W,  Thank you for your continued loyalty and for [another] great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay once more and truly appreciate the feedback and the kind compliments you have shared, as always. Thank you again for your insight, I look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We chose the Ayers Suites in Mission Viejo, Ca for a one night stay the day before Memorial Day.  The staff was very professional, the entire facility was very clean, our room was exceptionally comfortable and the cost was fair and affordable.  We are making the Ayers Suites our go to lodging choice for trips to Orange County.

The room had a mildew smell, the beds were hard and the sheets felt like sand paper. Also, the breakfast was terrible.  They were out of ketchup, plates and milk. Also, the only edible item was the cereal.

the staff was warm and looked after our every want. the hotel was clean and well maintained. the room was spacious and well thought out, with plenty of space to spread out and relax. I will go back again.

The person that checked us in was so pleasant and helpful. She was wonderful. The property is beautiful and away from the hub bub of the city but still so close to everything. The view from the window of our room was breathtaking. We could even see the ocean. A place to stay for anyone that needs a quiet beautiful place. Free Breakfast was a bonus and oh so yummy

Summary Heading: Superb!!!  Best place to stay, ever.
Summary: Everything is above excellent at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo, but at the top of the list is their staff.   They are courteous, polite and will do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable.  The rooms are very clean.  The rooms are quiet which makes for a good nights sleep.  The beds are quite comfortable.  There is a microwave and refrigerator in each room.  My wife and I love staying there.  We feel safe and comfortable, just like at home.  We highly recommend this hotel.  We even love their choice of classical music they play in the lobby and elevator.

I stayed at this hotel to get some much needed rest and relaxation. The setting is beautiful and quiet. The problem is that the hotel does not provide a guest guide in the room with available services, local businesses, restaurants, etc. The desk staff non-informative unless you ask a specific question.

Hotel has nice big room with all the amenities including free breakfast and happy hour. Front desk Charles was especially nice and personally exchanged our fridge which was not working. A very pleasant stay.

Overall rooms were fine and facility was decent but nothing to write home about.  I'd a little on the jinky side.  It was lacking something for a "resort"  Free breakfast was just ok.  Restaurant was small, central courtyard was bland.  A few things didn't work right.
Manager Response: Dear Warren G.,  We aim to provide our guests with excellent service, a great product, and at a reasonable price. We do not consider ourselves a resort, but a hotel that provides our guests the comforts of home while away from home. We love providing our complimentary breakfast to all of our guests to help ensure you get your day started off right. Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Joyfully,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Took a short getaway with my husband. Wanted to go to go San Diego but the hotel prices were a little steep. We decided to check out Mission Viejo because of its proximity to the beach and LA. Check-in was great. The staff person was very personable. Later on when I requested extra pillows a different staff person was a little frazzled but we did get the extra pillows as requested. The rooms were nicely set up with everything you'd need. The furnishings and carpets were a little tired looking but were clean. We were happy to hear that the hot tub was operational and used it daily. The restaurant was fine we did enjoy a snack and some beverages the first night. As we were on vacation we missed the breakfast offered during the week as it ended at 9am. You would definitely need a
Manager Response: Dear Kari D.,  I am pleased to see that we were able to assist you and your husband during your short getaway. It is great to hear that you were able to take advantage of our onsite jacuzzi, fire pit, and restaurant; which provides a full bar and menu. I hope that we have the opportunity to serve you and your husband again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Grandmas house or knotts berry farm
Summary: Mission Viejo doesn't exactly have a slew of hotel options so I understand why a 3 star can fetch $150. My hopes were not high. Place was clean but decorated as if it was the official sponsor of the log ride.

Summary Heading: Quiet Hotel in a Suburban Neighborhood
Summary: This is a good hotel for a nice sleep, but you would need a car to reach nearby attractions and restaurants.  I stay here frequently due to my company having a corporate rate, and the only complaint I have is the shower.  The water flow/pressure is too low for a nice refreshing shower.
Manager Response: Dear Shawn N.,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent business travels and for providing us with some valued insight into your experience. We truly value the relationship that our hotel has built with local companies around the area. We aim to provide their employees with a comfortable atmosphere which allows them to take their mind off of work and rejuvenate. Thank you for taking the time to provide a review and feedback about our hotel. We look forward to growing our relationship with you and your company!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: In and out over two weeks
Summary: The Ayres suites is as always a great easy place to stay. I returned to Rancho Santa margarita area for two weeks of training. Having lived there for a number of years I was invited to stay with friends for some of the nights. That meant I was in and out of the hotel like a yoyo. I changed my bookings on the fly and the staff were never flustered or upset by my erratic accommodation plans.  I always felt welcome and the amenities were great
Manager Response: Dear mlrumford,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a supportive review concerning our hotel. We aim to provide our guests with elevated hospitality through our customer service and the accommodations and services we provide. I am pleased to see that our team was helpful in fulfilling your requests throughout your stay. I hope that we have the pleasure of serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Great Hotel chain in SoCal and easy access off toll & major road ways.  Staff is courteous as well as knowledgeable of the area.  Plenty of options for recreation in the areas as well as the spa on the grounds.  Rooms are clean, quiet & spacious.  Great for a family or a business trip.
Manager Response: Dear dbowers75,  I appreciate you taking the time out of your day to write a review about our hotel. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found our team members accommodating. I hope we have the pleasure of serving you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: One of the few hotels with queen beds, since my hubby is not a elf! We stayed here for a softball tournament and the location was close to all available fields. The breakfast was perfect for kids with a competition that weekend. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous, even giving us a late checkout when we played better than we thought.  We took another teammate with us and both girls felt like royalty staying here.
Manager Response: Dear kitbit96,  Thank you for taking the time to share some feedback. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Your compliments regarding our premium amenities are warmly welcomed. Thank you again for your insight. I hope to serve you again soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The hotel has an inviting lobby, an evening reception, and hot breakfast which was appreciated but not great if I were to compare it to similarly priced hotels that offer free breakfast. The room was a generous size with a sliding glass door leading to a patio table and chairs. There was an insect (looked like a mosquito?) flying around my room that must have been let in by a previous guest, and didn't make a great first impression. The room was very clean otherwise, but did feature a bedspread on the bed, which I don't see often in hotels anymore (full disclaimer - I have no idea what the Ayres policy is on washing the bedspreads, but I peeled it off anyway just in case). I attempted to turn the heat on in the evening to warm up the room, but a horrible burning smell emanated

Our family has been coming here for years.  The GM and staff always make us feel like we are at home.  The beds are soooooo comfortable & its always clean and cozy.  Being located right off the toll road it its very conveniently located to all you want to experience in Orange County and beyond. This hotel far surpasses the one located on the same property and choose them if you don't want to be disappointed!
Manager Response: Dear Doreen C.,  We are overjoyed that we have been given the pleasure of serving you over the years and have succeeded in providing a home away from home. We provide every room with our Ayres Celestial Sleeper mattresses in order to provide an elevated stay for our guests. I am pleased to hear you enjoy them! We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect place for our scrapbook retreat
Summary: Nice hotel rooms-so clean and comfy beds. Excellent customer service and full breakfast. The Tuscany room was spacious  for a fun scrapbooking retreat with 14 ladies. The location at Los Alisos and the toll road was easily accessible yet quiet with great views.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca W.,  We are delighted that your scrapbooking retreat was a success! Being family owned and operated, we know the significance of bringing a group together under one roof to accomplish one goal. I am glad we could provide a space for you all to do just that. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and we hope to serve you again soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I stay after at this hotel as my company is in the area.  Pros: great room space, complete with small fridge, ceiling fan, lots of closet space, great bed. Check in fast efficient, evening dinner reception is nice, breakfast pretty good, evening cookies, a nice touch and always ample parking. The wifi is good too.   There are several restaurants within walking distance and even a really great sushi place.   Cons: the only con I have (and this is pretty minor) is tat you can hear everything going on in the halls. This time my room was near the guest laundry and I could hear the dryer clanking as I was trying to go to sleep. The other oddity I find is that as a green hotel, they of course ask you to save on water and energy costs. I'm totally on board with this but it takes

This is an excellent business hotel in a great Orange County location.   Good gym, pool, and clean spacious rooms.   But the extra value comes from the managers happy hour and full service breakfast.  There are also at least 4 restaurants and a CVS within a short walking distance.   All in a quiet neighborhood with great hillside views to the west.

We stay at this hotel whenever we are in the area- it is clean, quiet and conveniently located. The staff are friendly and welcoming! We have become Ayres fans and looks for this hotel chain first wherever we are traveling!!

I stay at Ayres regularly for extended periods and don't intend to change. Would like to see an upgrade to the gym, but otherwise very attentive service and excellent all-round value. Reliable, friendly and practical hotel.

Nice clean rooms, quiet and Charles provided great customer service. Will stay again when return.  Use margarite park way towards the 5 vs the toll road. 10 minutes from Mission Veijo. Good price for room.
Manager Response: Dear Larry B,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience as well as the cleanliness of our accommodations and the attentive service provided. Thank you again for your feedback. I look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Always friendly and welcoming with comfortable accommodations.  If there is a concern, it is dealt with immediately.  The rooms, pool, gym and breakfast room are just right! My home away from home in Mission Viejo.

As always, Ayres Suites has made my stay very delightful. The room was very neat and the people extra friendly. Both the breakfast and evening meals were above average.  This is an excellent hotel to stay at.

They worked really well, when we cancelled our 1 remaining day. Are plans changed and they accommodated without charging for being longer than expected from checkout time. Thanks for being so generous and look forward to visiting the area in the future.

I stay at an Ayres at least once a year for business trips. They are always immaculate, elegantly furnished, and staffed with quality personnel. My only complaint with this property is the one elevator access on the far end of the hotel. My room was on the other end and after a 14 hour day it was a long walk, indeed. I'll make sure to request a room a bit closer to the elevators next visit.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you need an ADA compliant wheelchair accessible room
Summary: My water heater broke so I needed a hotel room for a few days until it could be fixed. I had no heat and obviously no hot water due to this. I chose Ayers because of their reputation and the hotel is close to my home.   When I checked in the agent was really friendly and cheerfully helped me get my belongings to my room.   Immediately upon entering the room I noticed that the bed was too high for me to transfer to. It was well over the ADA height of between 17" - 19" high. Then I went into the bathroom and immediately noticed that the "roll-in" shower was really small, and was missing a bench. There was, however, a bench provided that had no back for support, or handles on it (would not work for me, and wouldn't work for most people with a spinal injury), and it wasn't flat, it

We had a quick "staycation" at the Ayres Suites last week just for the heck of it.  The rooms were simple, but spacious and clean.  The staff was very friendly and the included breakfast in the morning had several good options.  I would definitely recommend this property for families who need a little extra space at a reasonable cost.
Manager Response: Dear pkashinsky,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel and letting others know about your experience. The candid feedback you have provided and the kind compliments you have shared are warmly welcomed. It truly pleases me to know that you enjoyed your stay, the premium amenities, and the attentive service that we provide. Thank you again for your review and for recommending our hotel. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I have been to this hotel twice and will visit it again this year. There is nothing spectacular about the hotel, but it is a comfortable and quiet stay. A few dining choices are within walking distance, but better choices are within a short drive.

My husband and I came to town to visit a friend, and picked this hotel because it was right down the street from our friend's place. It was definitely a great choice! Our room was so nice, with its comfy bed and spacious area. I appreciated the fact that housekeeping only changes sheets if you request it, so as to save water. We will definitely stay here next time we visit!

Once again we had a great stay.  The hotel is always in top shape, the rooms are spacious and always spotless.  As usual we are greeted warmly by the friendly and very professional staff at the desk.  The free breakfast can't be beat.  Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when visiting Southern California.  Thanks Dean (the manager) for another perfect experience.
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth W,  Thank you kindly for your loyalty to our hotel and for writing a review to let others know about your experience. Your compliments regarding our exceptional and consistent service are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the feedback. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Haven't been in town for 8 months!  Came back to Mission Viejo & will ONLY stay at the AYRES MISSION VIEJO!  It is still the same......consistently WONDERFUL.  AMAZING STAFF.....always friendly & always making sure your stay is the best...very professional!  Always extremely comfortable.....the Beds are the BEST ever.
