Extremely clean, with every detail addressed.  Breakfast is AWESOME, as is the light dinner they have available!  We just won't stay anywhere else.  Even after an 8 month absence.....everything is the perfectly the same!  It is truly a home away from home!

Staff was friendly and accommodating.  We only stayed one night for a business trip, but I slept better than I have in a long time.  Bed was comfortable, room was clean, good shower pressure, all we could have asked for on a brief stay.  Breakfast was a great bonus.  Only downside is the "Regal" aesthetics, which appear tired and outdated, but not a big issue.

We had a room block for a wedding we were attending. The front staff was amazing! Very helpful and accommodating. We were on the third floor and the room was very clean and tidy. Overall great stay and will stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Diana G.,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review of our Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. I am contented to see that you enjoyed your experience. It was a pleasure to have served you and we look forward to doing so again!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: First time staying here. We came around lunch time and checking in immediately. Staff pleasant and helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable. Fan in bathroom really loud. Located close to the toll road and restaurants.Overall a good experience. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Deborah K,  Thank you so much taking the time to write a review. I am happy that you enjoyed your first stay at our hotel. Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided, it is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make any and all necessary improvements. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly, Helpful Staff make this a nice place to stay
Summary: The people working here make up for the average hotel fare. Rooms were dark, perhaps a California energy regulation. Putting on makeup is impossible in the dim light. Bring a mirror and sit by the window. Arrived half hour before Happy Hour ended food was gone, Bud, Bud Light were beer offerings also several wine selections. Breakfast was typical scrambled eggs, pancakes reheated too long.  Décor described as European chic with cool California, more like your grandma's house if her designer worked at a casino. It added to the darkness. Bed's were very comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear shinest,  Thank you so much for the valuable feedback you have provided ourselves and fellow travelers with. It is a delight that you enjoyed the service that our attentive team offers. Nevertheless, I regret that our guestrooms and layout left much to be desired and that our complimentary amenities were not up to par. We will certainly address the items we are able to update as soon as possible. I hope that this experience does not deter you from staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff, rooms are clean & comfortable. Free breakfast but not a lot of variety. Price is reasonable. Curtains keep room dark. No slip surfaces.  Need transportation as hotel is on busy roadway, but rooms are quiet.  Beds are comfortable. Towels are clean & soft.
Manager Response: Dear EireLover_13,  Thank you so much for the great review you have shared regarding your experience at our hotel. Your warm compliments concerning our team, the cleanliness of our hotel and the accommodations we offer are greatly appreciated. Also, thank you for sharing your concerns. We look forward to serving you again soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: On my last visit; August 29, I arrived with my bags ahead of check-in and without a word, the manager and office staff saw me coming and checked me in and handed me room keys...While I stay here on business often, it was unexpected and I was delighted at the personalized service given.    This place is amazing, the staff wonderful and they all anticipate to delight you on every little detail.  I am appreciative as I travel a lot and this service level doesn't get any better any where at Forbes rated properties.  I keep coming back for the delight I get when I get this type of service.  Thank you Ayres! You are the best!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel in great location
Summary: We enjoyed this hotel because it was near family and was convenient to the freeway to get around, The common areas and rooms are nicely furnished and the beds are super comfortable. The breakfast is nice and is included, but is nothing very special. If visiting Mission Viejo or Rancho Santa Margarita, this is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Excellent front desk personnel. Room was airy and comfortable.
Summary: Very happy overall, especially the folks at the front desk. They were to a person very helpful and cheery.  Breakfasts are very good and plentiful. Could you, though, incorporate some sugarless cereals in the menu?  Room was airy and comfortable but the lighting is just a bit dim in the room itself; otherwise the lighting (desk, bathroom) is more than plentiful.

I cannot get into too many details based on a one night stay.  However, it was a very nice hotel, clean and a nice location in the Mission Viejo area. The hotel is decorated very nice with a traditional theme.    We did not use the pool, but walked over to the area, again, very nice...with a hot tub too.  (note to self, always bring bathing suits).  The A/C worked good, nice TV, small fridge, micro and sink area.  The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable.    Breakfast was nice with offerings of hot foods; scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and hash browns, loved the hash browns.  Then the usual items such as diy toast, bagels, cold cereal and oatmeal in crock pot.    I plan on staying there again on next trip to see family.  Only thing I would think could be added, would be to

This is a very nice hotel.  It is very clean, comfortable and convenient.  There is a small refrigerator, a microwave, coffee maker and a small sink in the room.  The price was very reasonable as it also included free continental breakfast.  The employees were very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear IGlzr,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Your valuable insight is greatly appreciated. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay, the value of our hotel, and that our optimal location met your needs. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: During our 4-5-day stay for a wedding, a water main broke and the hotel was without water for most of a day. After the water was "back on" and we returned to the hotel to shower and dress for the wedding, we were not notified that the water was off again. This was very disappointing...
Manager Response: Dear gold42988,  Thank you kindly for your candid feedback. Though I regret to see that your experience at our hotel was anything less than exceptional, I truly value the insight you have provided us with. Please accept my most sincere apology with regards to the lack of communication, especially on such an important occasion. We hope that you kindly consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I used to stay in the Ayres Suites or in Ayres Spa because of my work, and always was an excellent service and installations(both), last time I brought my family and spent 5 days in the Spa(Excellent by the way) and then moved to Ayres Suites for another 4 days "What a Bad decision": Carpet smells like Old, you can felt the humidity in the room, side door entrance didn't work one day 10pm with my Kids sleeping in my arms- need to walk to the main entrance, and the worst "NO WATER" on saturday Aug 6th What? Are you kidding me?, No juice/coffee and dirty dishes all over the place because NO water to clean them. Wow.. re-Investment needs to come to this Hotel and be what it used to...
Manager Response: Dear Fernando0914,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and loyalty to our collection with us. While I wish you had a better experience at our hotel, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to make improvements. We work hard to redefine hospitality, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. Please accept my sincerest apologies with regards to the lack of consistency between the service from our hotel and our sister property. If you choose to give us a second chance, I can assure you that we will do our best to grant you the service that you deserve.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay at the Ayers/
Summary: Always have a fine time at the Ayers. My husband and I stay there quite frequently. The staff is fantastic.. Always remember our names. ASk if we need anything. PLUS, the cookies in the evening.. Love this home away from home.
Manager Response: Dear Julz75070,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share you feedback and let others know about your recent stay. We appreciate the loyalty and the kind compliments you have shared. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We usually stay at at the Ayres in Laguna Hills, but it was full. Ayres helped me with this  arrangement.  Although looking at a map LH and MV are very close, this hotel is about 10 miles from the freeway.  It's a drive into the hills of Mission Viejo. The included breakfast at MV does not compare to the delicious one your get at Laguna. The hotel is still decorated in the old world motif, but the rooms are a little worn out, but are very clean. The beds are well used also. The front desk staff were pleasant.

Excellent customer service really makes this place feel like a home away from home. The staff was happy to oblige with our request for extra pillows and the bed here is uber comfortable. Try to get a suite with a jacuzzi tub, one of the best Jacuzzi tubs we have ever had the benefit of enjoying. Do make your reservations in advance to get the best price on a room. Conveniently located near freeway entrances and shopping. A special perk was the Monday through Friday happy hour wine on the patio.

My husband and I spent almost 6 weeks at the Ayres Hotel Mission Viejo due to a water leak in our home. We had a pretty large suite which helped The staff was great and they serve a very nice breakfast each day. Then Mon -Thurs they have a "reception" from 5-7 with wine,beer and soft drinks plus a nice salad bar,veggies/dip, chips and salsa and a little main dish tacos,soup, pizza etc. so you don't have to go out if you don't want to plus fresh baked cookies.It wasn't home but it was a pleasant stay.

Hotel is very nice and great quality.  Rooms are updated, clean and beds are very comfortable.  Staff are super friendly and helpful.  Hot breakfast was delicious and I loved the coffee.  Excellent value.

I spent one night here just because Marriot was overbooked . The hotel is very nice , old stile , but clean and comfortable . It is close to the highway but is not a very noisy one . The hotel is full of amenities, pool spa etc. The only thing I didn't like was the breakfast little poor for the place

We stayed here 3 nights to attend a wedding anniversary.   My only concerns were the lack of a room safe and a very noisy bathroom fan.  In all other ways it was a delightful stay, attentive staff, clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear DiningDivaSF,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciated the feedback you have provided. We hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I stay here all the time because I absolutely love it! This time I think they may have been short staffed in the kitchen, there seemed to be one person working in there the two days I was there and he was cooking, cleaning, and restocking. My biggest complaint was they only had Styrofoam cups in the dining room. Will this stop me from recommending the Ayres hotels or staying in them myself? Absolutely and  emphatically not! It's a one off. Love it here and I'll be back, so will my friends who have stayed here on my recommendation and loved it as well.
Manager Response: Dear Alison F,  Thank you so much for your review. Your loyalty to our hotel is greatly appreciated, as is the feedback you have provided us with. Please rest assured that your concerns will be addressed. Thank kindly for your recommendation of our hotel and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We have always had a good experience with Ayres, and this was no exception. We chose this one as it was less expensive than the one in Laguna Hills where we have stayed before - proximity to relatives. This was not that much further out, but was a lovely property on a hill - with a nice view from the pool area. The staff was VERY friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our room was just right and had a refrigerator and microwave. The bottle of water in the frig was $4 - so watch out for that as the sign is ABOVE the frig and if you're thirsty, you might miss it!
Manager Response: Dear Ticketless55,  Thank you for the outstanding review of our hotel! I am contented to see that you had an enjoyable experience. Thank you kindly for your feedback and you warm compliments regarding our team. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We loved this hotel. The rooms we excellent and the beds are so comfortable. The breakfasts are definitely a step up from what you normally expect. Nice location if you don't have to be right on the beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear DShaline,  Thank you for taking the time to write a great review of our hotel! I am glad that you loved our hotel and accommodations. Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We stay here several times a year and feel like part of the family. From the great welcome we receive at the front desk, to the large, clean, well equipped rooms, best mattresses I've slept on in any hotel, you can't go wrong. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when in Southern California. A daily breakfast is included, handled perfectly by Miguel no matter how busy the hotel is. A manager's Happy Hour helps you wind down the day. The staff is great and tends to your every need.  Be back next month.

Summary Heading: Nice, and very affordable for Orange County
Summary: Hotel had a very nice and friendly staff.   The surrounding area was very nice, and the hotel itself was very clean,  and most importantly, it was very quite.  Access to and from Irvine was reasonable considering the traffic in Southern California.

Ayres Suites was a decent value. Once we learned how to pronounce the name-- The room was clean and comfortable, the pool was nice (not big like in the photo but okay), clean and not full of chlorine and an okay size for laps, and the breakfast was beyond the cheap-carbs-on-styrofoam-syndrome: real plates and utensils and a variety of breads, cereals, muesli; a hot bar with fried animals and hash browns. The freshly made salsas and fruit salad were a delicious plus. What I am trying to say is that a health, eco- and animal-conscious person can find something to eat here. I managed to bump into the card on the wall in the middle of the night which disabled our electricity (and the AC, which made for an uncomfortable night as the windows don't really open), so watch out for that.

Summary Heading: Nice overall experience.  Front desk staff is amazing.
Summary: The hotel is a classic design, clean with large rooms.  Front desk staff and management are fantastic.  Unfortunately this hotel has not maintained the standards of earlier years.  No longer do they make eggs to order and the breakfast was the same thing for 5 days.  Morning cook was very loud with dishes, seemed very busy and certainly needed assistance with the crowded hotel.  Be aware of The Creeper in room 108 (he creeped out my entire family & others).  He is a full-time resident (over 18 months) at the hotel who perves on all the girls, has hostile body language, slams doors, has no problem being confrontational with other hotel guests and seems unconscious that he is a guest at the hotel and his money does not make him more important than any other guest.  Numerous

Rooms were large, and beds firm. Fridge was just big enough to hold my drinks for the week. Walking distance to drugstore and a few eateries. There are hiking trails just up the road, for a relaxing walk in the hills.

A family wedding brought us from the East Coast to Mission Viejo.  The location of the Ayres Suites was convenient for all the events.  The rooms are clean and spacious and the staff was welcoming and helpful.  Having a full breakfast included, provided another opportunity to gather with family and friends and free parking was an added bonus.

This hotel was the perfect spot for our recent trip to Mission Viejo for a family event. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are huge. It had everything we needed. This is our second time at this hotel and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Our youth softball league booked 60 rooms at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo 3 weeks prior to arrival. The Sales manager who took care of our reservation was fully aware there would be over 70 children ranging from ages 6-13 staying for the weekend.  Upon arrival we were informed someone had spilled chips all throughout the hallway on the second floor.  The woman at the front desk specifically said it was from our group.  Later we all gathered by the small pool for some socializing and food. We were asked to gather everyone up and dine in the dining room - the only common area inside the hotel as to keep the kids from running around. Meantime one of our girls accidentally dropped her Iphone in the elevator shaft.  Her parents were told they would be charged 250.00 to retrieve.
Manager Response: Dear Softballmom550,  Our hotel designed a sports group policy and group room block agreement to not only ensure a favorable experience for the members of the group and others guests but to also ensure safety for everyone. The West Valley Girls Softball group and its chaperones not only violated all of the rules listed on the agreement, they did so in an incredibly hostile manner which made our team members feel threatened, to say the least, during your visit. The agreement that was signed by the group representative listed that "quiet time is from 10:00 pm until 9:00 am" and that "we require constant adult supervision". Oftentimes, we had unattended children causing great disturbance to other guests as early as 7:10 am and as late as 11 pm. As a result, a handful of our team members had to stay past their scheduled work hours. The signed agreements also stated that "Any trash left in common areas must be cleaned up". Cleaning the areas the group left messy also resulted in our team staying past their scheduled work hours. With all of this being said, we hope that your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying. Regards,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I travel for business all over Southern California. My first choice is the Ayres Family of boutique hotels. Each one has a common name and unique feel. My absolute most favorite ever is the Hotel and Suites in Mission Viejonear the 241. I Seriously have been coming back to this location because I get treated so well and the facility is great. The Manager Mr. Birtles has developed and maintained a magic formula for hiring, training, and retaining great staff. The front desk is always courteous and efficient. The rooms are comfortable,clean and meticulously maintained. This location is quite popular for weddings, sports tournaments, and all kinds of groups. I love it because they make the stay warm and welcoming. When you are comparing total costs don't forget that a great fresh

We recently stayed at Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo within a wedding-block of hotel rooms. With the Trip Advisor rating I was expecting a better experience. This hotel is dated and service was mediocre.  The room was very dated, the tv was small and the remote didn't work. The bed was very firm and the bedding was not that soft or comfortable. Sadly, I felt like I was a chain restaurant off the freeway in the middle of nowhere, not a hotel that tries to project an air of luxury and comfort.  The staff was ok, some staff were friendly others were simply unaware of guests standing in front of the counter or were ignoring the guests. They don't really exude a welcoming vibe or make any extra efforts to greet guests.  This place is convenient for weddings at Rancho Las Lomas, but
Manager Response: Dear Kate G,  Thank you for sharing feedback regarding your recent stay. I am saddened to hear that your experience at our hotel left much to be desired. Nevertheless, your candid feedback is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I hope that your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay in South Orange County
Summary: We used to live in Mission Viejo, and had come back to visit with friends and family.  The hotel is conveniently located (just be aware that it's right off of the 241 tollroad, so that could be confusing), clean and the staff is very helpful.  The bathroom/vanity areas are a bit small, and tight.  In order to close and/or open the bathroom door, the other person needed to leave the vanity area.   The closet doors weren't set properly, so it was hard to get things in and out.  We enjoyed the complimentary (full, not continental) breakfast each morning!  Too bad that the evening offering is only Monday - Thursday.  We were looking forward to that, and unfortunately didn't get to partake on Friday or Saturday.  :-(    Also, there was a huge wedding party staying at the hotel when

Summary Heading: Great place for wedding guests heading to Rancho Las Lomas
Summary: Arrived Wednesday early afternoon and were able to check into a 3rd floor room that was clean, comfortable with mini-fridge and microwave.  Desk, counters, small table and coffee table.  Caught up with old friends at the pool.  Long day, we were tired so grabbed heavy hors d'oeuvres at their 5pm hospitality hour.  Continued with fresh salad.  That was enough for a free dinner followed by a trip to check out Rancho Las Lomas, more connecting and bed. Over next three day enjoyed great breakfast buffet (oatmeal, eggs, fruit, juice - variety of bacon and sausage if you are so inclined we use best efforts to stick to Plant Based, Whole Foods).  Pool and spa were clean; exercise room moderately equipped.  One tip: most hotel rooms have AC built into the wall.  Can be noisy for

Summary Heading: A Gem of a Hotel in South Ocean County
Summary: Being a business traveler, I have Executive level or Gold level status with Hilton and  Starwood properties.  Each one of these companies offer lots of amenities to us regulars,  I enjoy them all.  However, when I travel California I stay at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo.    The reason is simple.  Staying her is like returning home after a long trip away. The staff know you by name, they know the type of rooms you like, and they welcome you like family.   The rooms are spacious, quiet and clean.  Breakfast is awesome with the right variation and the evening complementary light dinner with beer wine and soft drinks just rounds it out perfectly.   Whether you,re coming here on a business trip, visiting Rick Warren or on a family break, I highly recommend this home away from
Manager Response: Dear James P,  Thank you kindly for sharing your candid review on TripAdvisor. Your feedback is greatly valued and I appreciate you taking the time to let others know about your experience at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. Thank you so much for your kind compliments and for your continued loyalty. We look forward to your next stay.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice enough, but not nice enough for the price
Summary: They gave us a handicap accessible room, neither of us our in a wheelchair, so the closet, shower everything was awkward to use. Room decor was dated and felt like I was staying at my grandmas house, the bed was uncomfortable and the pillows weren't much better. For $160 a night, you would think there would be more
Manager Response: Dear lunarc2016,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. Please accept my sincere apologies for any confusion regarding your accommodations. I regret to read that the ambience of our hotel was not to your liking, nevertheless, your feedback is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. We hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Arrived early. They accommadated us.  Room large. Good lighting. Early breakfast was generous and able to serve a large group at once. Good location off freeway  Large meeting area- seating for large families. Bathroom area was very spacious.  Beautiful area around Hotel
Manager Response: Dear Kristin S.,  The entire team at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo strives to go above and beyond to ensure our valued guests receive exceptional service. It is a delight to see that we did just that during your stay. Thanks so much for your kind compliments regarding our accommodations, complimentary breakfast, as well as our optimal location. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: As usual, we had a great stay.  We stay here several times a year and are never disappointed.  The hotel is kept immaculate, the rooms are large and very comfortable. The bed and the mattress are great.  The staff is great, we always get a big welcome.  They make us feel at home, I cannot compliment them enough. The included breakfast is always good and as always, Miguel does a great job.  Looking forward to our next visit.  Thank you Dean (the manager) for always seeing to our every need,
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth W,  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Suites Mission Viejo time and time again. The feedback you have provided us with is greatly appreciated, as well as the compliments regarding our accommodations, cleanliness, and friendly team members. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Easy access from freeway without being right on the highway.  Everything was fine. Good breakfast. Clean. Quiet. Pleasant and capable staff. Classy ambiance. Fans in the hallways a good idea ... keep the air moving and fresh. We will go back.
Manager Response: Dear Darlene M,  I am delighted to see that you had a pleasant experience at our hotel. Your candid feedback is greatly appreciated along with your compliments concerning the cleanliness of our hotel, ambience, and our helpful team members. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We were looking for a hotel close to Saddleback Church and most of the hotels close by didn't have very good reviews so we weren't expecting very much when we booked. But we were surprised to find a beautifully furnished room, very tasty breakfast and extremely friendly, happy staff despite them working on Easter Sunday. Would definitely recommend it!

About the only negative thing I can say about the Ayers Mission Viejo is that it is not located near many restaurants or shopping.  Other than that, it is a great place to stay. There are two Ayers hotels on one site. I believe one has a luxury spa in it, so be sure to book the one you want.  I stayed in the one without a spa.  My dual queen room was  spacious, immaculately clean and well appointed. The bathroom had a jetted tub, marble floors and all the usual amenities, including a hair dryer and lots of  fluffy white towels.  The included breakfast was very good and included three types of scrambled eggs, hash browns, bacon and sausage. Cereal, toast/bagels, fresh oatmeal,  juices and other breakfast items were also offered. The room was quiet and comfortable.  The staff is

Summary Heading: This was a business & family trip
Summary: This was our third year staying at this hotel & every year has always been a nice experience. The room was great & the daily breakfast where good. The hotel was very clean. The staff very friendly. We have stayed at other hotels in the area in the past but have to say this is the best for your money.

Summary Heading: I stayed 2 nights for home renovations and couldn't of been more happy.
Summary: I had a large 2 bedroom suite for my family with very comfortable king beds. During the week they offer a complimentary evening reception and every morning they a have a full hot breakfast YUMMY! The staff was amazing and I want to thank Dean, Valerie, Kelley, Jeff, Tawny, Madison, Walter, Nicole& Nick for making us feel so welcomed.

Our room was large and comfortable.  Perfect place to stay near our family, convenient to everything. We were impressed with the staff.  When we checked in, the person on the desk noticed my husbands retired military ID card and gave us an additional discount.

The hotel is great and the people very friendly.  I am accustomed to staying at Forbes rated hotels and this one isn't rated but you get 5 star service.  They have a wonderful breakfast every day (for business travelers this is great and a happy hour reception which is hard to beat at the local restaurants.  The price is perfect!  The hotel would be a wonderful spot for vacationing to but I feel special when there on business.  It is a beautiful spot and hotel and the people there re lovely.

The rooms are big, clean, and quiet. The beds are comfy and the serve a full breakfast that was yummy!, we were there this past weekend for a wedding. The reception was nearby so quite a few of us stayed there. We had an issue and management fixed it quickly!! We would stay again in a minute!!

Summary Heading: A nice spot to stay in Mission Viejo
Summary: I was most impressed with the friendly staff, the desk clerk was helpful and printed directions for me, it was nice he took the time to help. The room was quiet, spacious, and clean with comfortable beds. The free breakfast was a bonus. Would have liked to see bananas, but other than that there was ample choices.

I appreciated the warm greeting and great attitude of the woman at the front desk. The Executive room with 2 queen beds was roomy and comfortable, but this shower was just about non functioning! The water literally dribbled out...tried adjusting it but nothing. So I would avoid rm 234. Our weekend visit found the kitchen staff for the included breakfast to be utterly incompetent at making adequate food for the half full breakfast room.They were out of absolutely everything, no eggs, sausage , bacon, pancakes, fruit... asked if she was able to replenish some of the items she merely said "too busy" and replaced the silverware that had been completely empty. We waited 15-20 minutes to see if we could get breakfast as we were moving my daughter into her first apt. after college that
Manager Response: Dear jujube,  Thank kindly for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. Though I am happy to hear that our team members at the front desk were cordial, it saddens me that your experience was anything less than exceptional. Regarding room 234, the water pressure was checked and was streaming normally, nevertheless, we apologize that it was not up to par with your standards. Our team constantly strives to provide outstanding service and it is apparent that we fell short of our highest commitment during your stay. We kindly ask that you consider giving us another opportunity to provide you with the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This was our second time staying in an Ayres facility,  and it won't be our last. The rooms are large, spacious, and quiet. The breakfast is delicious! The swimming pool and spa were being remodeled and were closed. We will be back.

Rooms were well kept and clean.  Breakfast was great.  We had an odd smell (sewage?) in our room that we couldn't get to go away.   Also, we accidentally left some items in the room after checkout, returned later in the evening to request them and were informed that they had them in the "house keeping closet" but could not retrieve them until the following day.  We ended up just leaving them.  It was nothing important but odd that they couldn't retrieve our items from their house keeping closet.

This was our first of the many days my family will be staying at Ayers Mission Viejo in 2016. And as always, our experience was fantastic. Clean rooms, quiet evenings, and the staff that treats us with such a welcoming attitude. Valerie and Kelley were my initial contacts. Tawny met my wife and I at arrival. The check in process was quick and problem free. Then at checkout, Dean asked first how was our New Year so far, and had already emailed my bill. Always Ayers Mission Viejo. There truly is no better place to stay in Southern Cali.  For family trips or romantic getaways, we just love this place...Always.
Manager Response: Dear Barry B,  I am humbled to read that we made such an impression during your stay. The team at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo continually strives to provide exceptional service; I am glad we were able to do just that for you. Thank you again for your review and ​we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: From the minute I walked in , I felt at home as  the front desk was extremely helpful and knowledgeable . We took their suggestions a few times and all was good. The  rooms were on the larger size for a hotel room .  We had the  breakfast both mornings and the coffee was good too.

Every time I stay at the Ayres Suites, it never disappoints.  Their staff is so friendly and accommodating and the GM is always there to say hello and make sure our stay is better than the last.  Thanks again!!!!

Summary Heading: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN ORANGE COUNTY!
Summary: Just saying - The Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo is by far the best place to stay when in Orange County & here are just a few of the reasons: Polite & Professional Staff - they are the BEST! Consistently Clean Very Classy Room cost is very competitive  Conveniently Located - right off the 241 Toll Road Great Full Breakfast Great lite dinner Nice glass of wine or beer Very peaceful & quiet YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED! We have stayed there for years and plan to for many more to come whenever we are in Orange County....which is almost every week.  We wouldn't THINK of staying anywhere else!

I'm not a big fan of the decor (I like a modern/Scandanavian style), but there is no mistaking the high quality.  Large rooms with comfy beds, microwave, minifridge, coffeemaker, plenty of drawer space (a necessity for longer stays), good breakfast.  Excellent staff.

The room old ac/heat was really loud when on so  it was 5 sleepless nighs for us. We enjoyed their hot breakfast, exercise room and pool/jacuzzi. Excellent service except the lady serving our breakfast was rude! I hope one day they would replace their ac/heat unit to a newer model.

Exceptional front desk service, even with the miscommunication regarding the 1/2 day extra I pay for to ensure check out at 9 p.m. Refrigerator did not keep food cold, thus I had to toss a tuna sandwich that was not kept cold enough, even at coolest (and loudest) setting. No sweets at breakfast...muffins, Danish, cake, etc. Stained sheets (yuk!) on first night.  Never again afterwards.

As usual this was a great stay.  We are always treated like VIPs and we love the large rooms, free breakfast, and manager's cocktail hour.  The hotel is always spotless and they make us feel at home.  Miguel handles the breakfast like a magician and always remembers what we like.  Thanks for a great stay.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay off the beaten track.  Quiet hotel....
Summary: We had excellent service as usual, a very clean & comfortable room, very easy and gracious  check-in.  The hotel is quiet and they are very accommodating on special requests.  The only negative was the breakfast was cold and unappetizing.

Summary Heading: Elegant hotel, great location and excellent service!
Summary: The rooms here are very large and beautifully decorated.  Microwave and refrigerator.  Desk and chair and another sitting area and a wet bar.  Outdoor pool and spa.  Delicious hot fresh cooked breakfast in the morning.  Coin laundry.  The front desk staff and especially Kelley were very helpful.  Restaurants within walking distance.  Fitness center.
Manager Response: Dear eabarrdvm,  Thank you for reviewing your recent stay with us. It is always a pleasure to offer our valued guests warm and friendly service. Our location truly is convenient and well thought out for the convenience of our guests. We hope you will return soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent place to lay your head
Summary: Stayed here for two nights while visiting family so we were looking for a bit of a "home away from home".  While large enough, the suite was stark. The sitting area sofa was not the most comfortable, and the entire suite felt incomplete. There was no information about the area, no extra blanket or pillows, and the bathroom lighting was dim, making it tough to put make up on.  The rate included breakfast which was adequate, with several hot choices: scrambled eggs, omelette, waffle, oatmeal, etc.  the breakfast room was very crowded and noisy.  The staff was friendly and professional. The room itself was just not welcoming.
Manager Response: Dear Gingy Q.,  Thank you for your sincere feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I would also like to thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you. I am disappointed to read that you found the room lacking. We truly appreciate your feedback as it helps us better serve our guests and evaluate our rates and accommodations. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff is attentive and the free breakfast is the real deal. I spent the weekend here with my grandson. He is a picky teenager and he liked it! I would definitely stay here again. Great for families or solo travel. Perfect.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for a few nights
Summary: Accommodation such as this is purely utilitarian and therefore should be judged accordingly: 1. Rooms are spacious and clean. 2. Staff are reasonably friendly albeit insincere 3. Restaurant only available at the hotel and then only open for dinner 4. Breakfast and "Happy Hour" at the suites are alright 5. No lunch available  I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

This is a great hotel chain with excellent value.  They offer a very nice complimentary breakfast that is better than the competition as well as a happy hour with beer/wine and tacos.  The rooms are spacious and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Room was large with two queen beds and slept comfortably.  Breakfast was provided and offered a nice selection of choices.  We attended a wedding and a room block was provided for guests.  Front desk staff was accommodating and friendly.

Summary Heading: Right Down The Middle But Just Fine
Summary: This was not a luxury accommodation. Having said that, we loved it. The facility was in order, the staff was efficient, and the service was wonderful.  When you check in at the reception area, you're in the middle of the lobby. Everything is in order, the decor is in good repair, and the furniture is arranged nicely. The hotel itself is neat, clean and presents an inviting appearance. Our room was clean. There was a sink and vanity in the bedroom area as well as the bathroom side. Temperature control was easy on the wall unit. Linen was nice and clean.  The breakfast service was well run, efficient and courteous. Even when the flow of patrons ran to the extreme (imagine an influx of high-school water polo teams), the service continued uninterrupted and well supplied.Choice was
Manager Response: Dear StrengerMan,  Thank you for your detailed review of our hotel. We appreciate your kind compliments regarding our exceptional team, exclusive complimentary breakfast, and our well-appointed accommodations. We apologize that the hotel was a little noisy but are very pleased to see that our outstanding front desk team was able handle the situation in a timely and professional manner. Thank you again for choosing us and we look forward to welcoming you back any time you return to the area!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Our extended family stayed at the Ayers Suites for my sister's wedding in August, 2015.  We found the rooms spacious and clean with the nice touch of a small refrigerator and microwave in our room.  The staff was the best....very accommodating, friendly and responsive to all requests.  The pool area was a great meeting area....we gathered there for meals as well as in the evening.  Would definitely stay again!

Being repeat visitors to this fine Hotel, it is very refreshing to have staff remember you. Everyone is so kind and accommodating. The rooms are spacious, spotless,and meet all your needs. The free, tasty breakfast,which is actually cooked by the staff chef is an added bonus. We've made Ayres Suites Mission Viejo, our hotel of choice for several years now and will continue to do so. Marie M.

The service is great, their suites are pretty and spacious with microwave, mini bar and coffee maker (the coffe is really good). The WiFi connection works perfectly, I didn't have The time to even look at the pool because I was there for business but I really enjoyed my stay, I couls sleep really well and The cleaning service is good, everything was always very clean. If you're hungry you can always grab an apple from the lobby living area. Loved this hotel.

I walked in the door and immediately relaxed and felt like I had come home. Warmth and casual old world charm. The staff are friendly and professional. My room was lovely, very comfortable. Immaculately clean. Great shower, wonderful tub for a relaxing soak. They had a lovely evening social with yummy nibbles followed by warm, fresh-baked cookies at the front desk. The bed and pillows were great. This is the second Ayres I've tried,  and after a recent experience with a so-called comparable chain, I won't be staying anywhere else but with Ayres Hotels.

Summary Heading: Used for our wedding, decent service and affordable price
Summary: Had a great stay overall.  They were responsive throughout the process though we would have liked that they worked more with us on booking an event in their hotel.  Left no room on the table for negotiation.  Also, mishandled some of our guests reservations and allowed some of them to charge our credit card.  But overall, worth the price (clean rooms and nice location).
Manager Response: Dear Zack P.,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. I apologize sincerely for any inconsistencies which occurred during your stay but am glad to see that you enjoyed your time with us overall. We certainly hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: This hotel has very strong 'air freshener' that is impossible to get away from, and when I reported it, I was told by the general manager that he hadn't had a complaint in 10 years. So the next day, still suffering from the overwhelming offense, I called to ask if I could get some relief. I was placed in a 'suite' that had a stench that was reminiscent of a carcass in a very deep crevice that is apparently impossible to clean. This place decorated very nicely and the beds are very comfortable except the sheets are coarse, and they didn't even supply basic amenities like shampoo. Since they obviously don't understand scent sensitivity, it's unlikely that it would be usable anyway.
Manager Response: Dear vkey2sing,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I apologize that the air freshener was too strong and that the sheets for the bed were not to your liking. We thank you for taking the time to leave an honost review on TripAdvisor so that we may use your feedback to improve our hotel for present and future guests.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: From the moment I arrived to the final good by, the entire staff was very professional. My room was carefully tended to daily, I had all of the amenities that I needed. The pool and spa area were just what I was looking for.

Was here for business, stayed 5 nights. Great location and views. Far enough away from the bustle, but close enough to get anything you need. Great staff, good breakfast and Manager's evening social. All the amenities of the big boys, but also a great personal touch. Rooms are big, very clean and fresh, and richly furnished. Would highly recommend! Already planning my return to this hotel.

I always book with the Ayres Family hotels while I am in California, honestly and with confidence I admit the Ayres Suites are all charming , elegant , comfortable, and clean. You could not go wrong in booking with the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo, I did while I was visiting California in July 2015. Their rates are truly competitive , their service is outstanding , their breakfast buffet is honestly Better than your five stars hotel chains, considering the free breakfast. Book there and come back to my review and agree with me! Just do it.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for overnight in Mission Viejo area
Summary: This is our second stay. I like everything about the hotel except, the beds are very firm and the amenities are minimal.  The shampoo is a mix shampoo and conditioner which is not very good quality, there are no Q tips,shower cap, or glasses in the bathroom.  The room has a nice coffee maker with both regular and decaf coffee.  There is a complimentary breakfast which is really good,,lots to choose from (eggs, meats, yogurt,fruit, breads, etc).   Also FREE fast Wi-Fi.  Overall,the hotel is quiet, clean and the staff very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Dotti143,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. Your feedback is vital in ensuring each of our guests has a comfortable and enjoyable stay. We certainly appreciate your kind comments regarding our exclusive full American breakfast, as well as our exceptional team. We apologize that the our Ayres Elevated custom conditioning shampoo was unpleasant and that our Ayres Dreamsleeper was too firm for your taste. We absolutely appreciate your feedback and hope to see you back in the near future!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: While we did like the hotel very much in most aspects, there were a couple of things that need to be improved. We stayed in one room where the door when closed was a good 3/8 to 1/2 inch ajar. The door was loose in the frame and the strike plate was broken. I brought this to the attention of the management on the first day and when we returned, they indicated it was fixed. The plate was still broken and the door was not aligned in the frame. We asked for a new room and that was much better. But to say it was fixed and it not being fixed was wrong. The A/C was a bit noisy. The breakfast was pretty good but the lead server seems to have an attitude problem. The other servers seem to be very nice as was the front desk staff. The hotel was clean otherwise and quiet except for the
Manager Response: Dear Gjfromwa,  Thank you kindly for your candid review of our hotel. I greatly apologize that your experience with us was anything less than exceptional. I apologize that you had trouble with the door and that the communication regarding the door being fixed was incorrect. We were glad to have the availability to move you to a more acceptable room. We have gone over the service inconsistencies with our team as top-notch guest service is always our goal to ensure each guest has a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Thank you for your honest review, we hope to serve you again soon.  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Value, friendly service, quiet and conveniently located.
Summary: Stayed here for Water Polo Junior Olympics.  Breakfast was fresh and abundant even with a high demand at breakfast.   Rooms were clean and comfortable.   Staff was friendly and eager to please.   Would definitely stay here again.

Ayers hotel and suits are the best. Clean, well appointed, reasonably priced and the breakfast is wonderful. They will make an omelette on the spot or you can choose from a large select of breakfast foods and fruits.  It saved us money, we ate the happy hour for dinner. Tacos, cheeses, wine and beer and an excellent breakfast. The cookies go fast, if you see them, take one quick.

We can't say enough about everything at the Ayers Mission Viejo, Calif.  the staff, guest rooms, spacious, lobby comfortable, the event in the Tuscany Room, the area (beautiful landscape, shopping within walking distance), great breakfast, price, great location, accessible rooms available.

Our stay was wonderful.  We were greeted by friendly smiling staff.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  We stayed for 3 nights and had no problems.  All the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing I would suggest is they move the smoking area around the corner of the hotel not by the front door. We will be staying here again.

As always, we had a great stay.  From the great welcome we receive from the front desk, to the large, clean, well equipped rooms, you can't go wrong.  We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when in Southern California.  A daily breakfast is included, handled perfectly by Miguel no matter how busy the hotel is. A manager's Happy Hour helps you wind down the day.  We will see you again in September.

Very nice, clean and relatively new hotel. Had a vey nice stay. Hotel staff was very friendly. Very nice breakfast every day. Cookies, wine, beer, and soda, with snack at night from 5:00pm to 7:00pm Monday through Thursday.

Summary Heading: This hotel is a winner in all categories!!
Summary: Everything about this hotel is fabulous--the management, the ambiance, the top-notch staff, the accommodations and the mealtime goodies!!! We loved discovering this Ayres property and we'll be back!!! Everything about this hotel makes it a winner and the location adjacent to the toll road ensures easy driving throughout southeast Orange County.

Our stay had a few ups and downs but the front desk staff was amazing with assisting us in resolving all of the issues that we encountered. Out first night we were booked in a room that had a horrible smell. I was not able to sleep very well because of the smell and I let the front desk know about the issue. Also, the room was on the north end of the hotel and the elevators are only on the south end of the hotel. It is a LONG walk to the elevator everytime we had to leave. We couldn't use the stairs because of the stroller. Nonetheless, they moved us to another room the next morning that was actually larger and smelled much better. They even had the entire second floor carpet cleaned the next day (this is where our first room was located). I thought that was really thorough. The

Our experience at Ayres Suites couldn't have been more pleasant.  The room was clean and quiet; the staff pleasant and courteous, the location was perfect since our family lives only ten minutes away.  Having coffee and juice available 24/7 is a huge plus, and the breakfast was wonderful.  We will definitely stay there again, and thanks.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you are in town or need extra room for guests.
Summary: Hotel staff very friendly. Good breakfast and snacks. Plenty of parking and close by stores if you need something you forgot. Hotel is very well maintained and pool was relaxing. Love the cookies at night.

This was my second stay due to family emergency. I was so pleased the first time I recommended it to others and they were just as pleased. Great rooms at great prices along with amenities to make our stay more pleasant. Thank you again.

My work put me up at ayers mission viejo a year ago when I first started working for them last year.  This past week I came to the home office to work while my family enjoyed the southern CA weather.  Once again ayers proved to be a first class operation.  My wife was impressed w the facility an staff.

Lovely room and excellent service. Loved the cookies in the evening. Warm friendly people. The location was great, many shops and places to eat within walking distance. Our room was lovely, and had all the amenities.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay... They are a "YES" hotel
Summary: I just got married and had all of my guests stay at this hotel. From start to finish they were so incredibly accomodating. They checked in weekly with me and every single question I asked they always said yes to myself and my guests. The hotel is clean and accomodating. The rooms are decent in size. There is a fantastic breakfast included and the staff is very friendly, especially Doreen, she is the best!!! I highly recommend this place.

Our trip to sunny California was to visit our son who lives in Mission Viejo. The ayers suites was the perfect location,easy to get to from the airport and a wonderful view of the mountains. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Though we only stayed a few days it felt like home. The staff was friendly and attentitive to our needs. The pool was a nice place to relax at after a day of site seeing. The breakfast was an added be benefit. A good variety and well made. We will be staying again next visit!

As a business traveler, I am quite tired of staying in hotels, but the Ayres Suites has been a refreshing surprise helping to make even frequent travel tolerable and even quite pleasant at times.  I look forward to staying again for my next trip without dreading the old standby hotels. . .

Summary Heading: Great value, excellent customer service, feels like home!
Summary: Whether coming in for a day, a week, or several weeks as I do for business, the staff always make sure you have a great stay and start it out with a warm greeting and friendly smile.  Everyone on every shift just makes you feel so welcome and at home.  Whatever you need, you get!  The chef in the breakfast area is fabulous.  He always makes great food and will cook to order, with a big smile.  Great property as well, the pool is fabulous, so serene and big enough for multiple guests. Every time I am in South Orange County I stay at this lovely hotel.

You can rest excellent  Space in Rooms are good They offer water as a courtesy Everything is very good (parking , bathroom ) However breakfast included is not so good , it could be better (eggs have not flavor at all ) but it's a very good option in general terms

Summary Heading: "There Staff always Makes Sure You Have A Great Stay "
Summary: Almost Once A Year We Stay A Three Day Weekend When We Have Business In Rancho Santa Margarita  .We Love The Breakfast .This Summer I Would Like To Take My Family to Disneyland And Stay At The Ayers Hotel  In Anaheim. With Their Great Service I get In Mission Viejo  I Can Wait To Try The One In Anaheim

We were there with three other couples.  We all expected a moderate hotel chain.  We were surprised and impressed by everything--lobby, front desk service, room and FULL breakfast. We highly recommend it and would stay again.  Thank you.

I've had the pleasure of staying at this property multiple times now, and am always very satisfied. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable accommodations, great breakfast. There's plenty of restaurants nearby, some within walking distance down the hill. Quick access to the 241 toll road makes for an easy trip to Irvine, Corona, or South County.

Summary Heading: The Best Place to stay in So Cal!
Summary: Ayers Hotels is always an awesome experience. When we walk in, it is like we just arrived as family members. Kelly, Tawny, Valerie, Jeff...the list goes on, welcome my family with smiles and professionalism. And why not? As an administrator, Mr. Dean Birtles is just as friendly and conscientious of his customer's needs. Together as a team, this staff is as wonderful as the accommodations. The rooms are clean, large, quiet; and the atmosphere is pure class. If that is not enough, Mondays to Thursdays have a free appetizer and drink social time, and every morning is a full breakfast included with the room. Ayers Hotels has it all at a very reasonable price. My family stays at this hotel at least 6 times per year.

Summary Heading: This is a wonderful place to stay
Summary: I really enjoy staying here… It is the happy medium in every way. The grounds are beautiful and the facilities are well-kept. The staff is always professional and available. The sitting room at the entrance is a perfect place to meet friends and simply sit and talk. The rooms are clean and neat and well appointed. The bath is clean and spacious and is quite comfortable… it is strongly a four-star hotel! And that says a lot! It is a great value for a great stay!

We came for our niece's wedding and booked a suite for two nights. Everyone was so friendly and accommodating.  Having breakfast onsite was wonderful as we could connect with family and friends before the wedding.  Would come back again.

Great 3 night stay, polite staff. Breakfast had eggs and bacon etc. Room was always well cleaned. Bed I found to be comfortable. A bit nicer in my opinion than like a holiday inn, a little more character.

I stayed at this hotel this week on a business trip. It reminds me of a residence inn . Its clean, staff was friendly and professional  . Breakfast was ok but similar to a residence inn . I didn't have enough time to try and of the facilities so can't  comment and them

I stayed here so I could study for my final exam a day before and a week prior. I was able to check in really early and they were so accomodating with this request. I got great views on both days I've stayed and was greeted and welcomed each time. Thank you for a quiet, clean, wonderful rooms and for your great customer services from the Gen Mgr, Front Desk clerk, housekeeping and for the generous snack/breakfast rooms. Looking forward to staying here again!

Upon our arrival Jennifer was so accommodating and worked with us to get an upgrade on short notice!  Checkout was smooth, as well.  I wish I could remember the two ladies names that were so friendly!  Rooms were in good condition and plenty of space!

Have stayed here for business the last 6 out of 7 years. Last year tried the Marriot just to compare. What a mistake, from the fresh cookies at the front desk to the free hot food and beverages at night you will not find a better "home away from home". Great staff, super clean with great attention to details. Mark

I spent two nights here in March during the weekdays for a business trip. Upon entering, the concierge was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very well-kept and in great condition. I had a room away from the courtyard toward the back parking lot. I liked it much better that way. It seemed as though if you had a room facing the courtyard, it would be loud. My room was very spacious and clean! I even took a bath, which I normally refrain from doing.  Interesting fact, but totally random-I feel that the rooms are built for taller people. The sink counter was higher, the buffet table by the desk was higher, the desk and chair were bigger.  Additionally, there's a pull-out couch in the room that can accommodate more people, which is always a plus. It was very quiet at

I traveled from Florida over Presidents Day weekend and stayed at the Ayers Mission Viejo and in all my business stays over the years this hotel was one of the finest I have ever experienced!!  I would highly recommend to anyone!

Summary Heading: Nobody Does It Better Than Ayres MV
Summary: After many years of staying at the Ayres Mission Viejo, we still choose to stay ONLY at the Ayres Mission Viejo, when in Orange County.  The hotel is consistently spotless.  The staff is stellar & extremely helpful & accommodating at every level.  They have a great full breakfast in the morning & in the evening, a lite supper, beer & wine.  We are always happy to arrive at the Ayres MV.....& you will too if you choose to stay there.  It is directly off of the 241 toll road, so it is extremely convenient.  We highly recommend staying at the Ayres MV.  It is a home away from home.  You won't be sorry!!!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for what we needed
Summary: My daughter and I were in SoCal to visit another daughter for the weekend. This hotel was close to where we needed to be. The term 'Suites' in the name is a little misleading as we've stayed in other suites hotels which had a separate bedroom and living room area. We did find the rooms to be very large and we had two queen beds which served us well. We were on the go all weekend so only slept at the hotel and can't really comment on the breakfast. It was nice to have the hot drinks and juice available at night as well.

My wife and I stay here 3 or 4 times a year and are always impressed with the entire experience,  from the moment we are greeted by the staff at the desk, to the spacious, well kept rooms, the most comfortable beds, and the great & free breakfast.  They never disappoint.  We wouldn't think of staying anyplace else when we visit the area.

We had a wonderful time.  The rooms are fairly standard with the addition of a sink, microwave and fridge.  Free breakfast, free internet and free parking.  The only downside is the location is right off the toll roads.  The upside- very little traffic to and from Disney.  Beds and linens were comfy.  Great for our little family.

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem with a mountain view
Summary: This is the only hotel that I book when visiting the southern Cal area. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean with microwaves, coffee makers, irons, and mini refrigerators. The Ayres Hotel is meticulous in their appearance and have luxurious furnishings. The hotel has perks such a full breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, OJ, coffee, just to name a few.) It also hosts a happy hour Mon-Thur from 5-7 pm with food,wine and beer. This hotel is convenient to the 241, I-5, I-405 and just 30 minutes away from the beautiful California coast and beaches. This hotel is never a gamble and is always in top shape. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and attentive. There is a hot tub, pool, and workout room. Many great restaurant's are a

Summary Heading: There is Not a better hotel in Orange County, for value, cleanliness, location, and personal service.

Summary Heading: Great value, great staff and REALLY REALLY CLEAN !

Manuel in the dining room was great, Tawny and Nicole were wonderful at the front desk. Everyone was at the top of their game. I will be sure to stay here whenever I'm in the area.

Summary Heading: A great place - and a better value
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times - it is nicely furnished, very clean, very well maintained, and the staff is great.  It's also extremely reasonably priced for a hotel with the amenities that are offered.  It's definitely worth it.  The only minor issue is that it's not that close to the 405 freeway, and although it's right next to the 241 toll road, the toll roads no longer accept cash, which can make getting to the hotel a bit circuitous if you don't want to (or can't) use the one time toll option available online.  But that's a minor inconvenience when this hotel is compared to others I have stayed at in the area.  Basically, I only stay at other hotels when this one is fully booked.

I thank you and look forward to your continued support!   Kind Regards,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary: Stayed one night, comfortable, terrific staff, lots of amenities like microwave ,refrigerator,etc. Like embassy suites except one room.and  free coffee and tea 24 hours a day. Don't miss The free breakfast has lots of choices from eggs, bacon to pancakes and juices. I am very particular, found the bed confortable. Lots of stores close.
Manager Response: Dear Lobster5,   Thank you for your glowing review regarding your recent stay with us! The complimentary amenities are absolutely an added luxury that we are honored to be able to offer our guests. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our breakfast and thought our Ayres Dream Sleeper was comfortable. Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Mission Viejo and we look forward to serving you again!   Warm Regards,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary Heading: We like Ayres Suites very much.
Summary: My family stayed at this property in July. My husband and I had one of their higher category rooms and we feel that was a little extra money well spent. We were on the top floor with a view out over the valley area. Our room was recently renovated and very clean. Other family members opted for lesser expensive rooms and mostly had views of the parking lot. The manager’s reception and the daily breakfasts were fine for what we paid. Nothing special, but decent food and friendly service. Elevator service was excellent with two cars to serve just 3 floors. However there is only one elevator area, and it’s at one end of the hotel. This makes for a long walk down the hall if your room is at the opposite end of the hotel from the elevator area for your floor. Each floor has vending
Manager Response: Dear cclee,   Thank you kindly for choosing Ayres Suites Mission Viejo and for writing a detailed review regarding your recent stay. I am pleased to hear that we were overall able to exceed your expectations that our staff was able to respond to each of your requests quickly and efficiently . We do make every effort to provide exceptional customer service for all of our valued guests during the duration of each visit. Thank you again for your recommendation and we look forward to seeing you again in the future!   Kind Regards,  Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for three nights and could not recommend it more highly. The front desk staff were wonderful (especially Tawny), and they answered all our questions about the area, as well as greeted us every time we entered or left the hotel. The room was spacious, comfortable, and most of all very quiet. We were also impressed with the woman who ran the dining room in the evenings.  I would have given the hotel five stars, except that the ice machine did not work on our floor the entire time we were there, and at breakfast, they ran out of juice, coffee, and fruit and did not replace them while we were there. Other than that, we had a wonderful time here and would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Arlo89,   Thank you for choosing the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo and for your detailed review regarding your recent stay. I do apologize for the inconveniences you experienced with the ice machine as well as the replenishment of some of our breakfast items. It is truly uncharacteristic for items to run out and not be replenished in a timely fashion for our guests. I am, however, pleased to see that our staff offered exceptional customer service for the entire length of your stay. We pride ourselves in having friendly, attentive staff who contribute a great deal to the atmosphere of our hotel. Thank you again for your time in writing your review and we look forward to serving you again in the future!   Kind Regards,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great value and excellence in customer service
Summary: This charming yet modern and business friendly hotel has perfected the art of customer service.  The employees are empowered to make it right and it shows.  My company partners with this hotel for all of our travelers from around the globe each month and every one of them has had a wonderful experience in this hotel, they have become an extension of our customer service team.  The value for the rooms at this hotel are incredible and our guests are always impressed with us because we accommodate them at this hotel.  They have a wonderful chef who cooks an outstanding breakfast every morning served buffet style that is casual yet elegant with the elegant surroundings.  Just like any other business they aren't perfect every moment and things go wrong, but they always make it right!
Manager Response: Dear Sandra J,   Thank you for your enthusiastic review regarding your experience with our hotel. I am pleased to see that your company has partnered with our hotel and that each guest has had a positively memorable experience. Our chefs work consistently and diligently to prepare and serve a delicious breakfast to start each guest's day right. Please accept my most sincere gratitude for your compliments and we look forward to your continued loyalty to Ayres Suites Mission Viejo.   Warm Regards,  Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary Heading: No Wi-Fi is not good for a business traveler
Summary: Stayed here one night on business.  I've stayed at other Ayres properties and like the "family-owned" style of the business.  Unfortunately, there was an issue with the hotel's wi-fi when I desperately needed it to prepare for the next day's meeting.  I was given the free access code for the wi-fi network and my laptop connected just fine, but after 5 minutes of usage, the yellow exclamation would pop up on my wi-fi meter indicating that the connection wasn't operating properly.  It would work if I disconnected and then re-connected, but by then my office VPN connection had terminated and I had to start all over.  I called the front desk for assistance and they were helpful and transferred me to the third party IT support that services the hotel.  The support tech tried a number
Manager Response: Dear dkauf,   I would like to thank you for being a loyal return guest to our Ayres properties and for leaving a detailed review on your most recent stay. I was glad to see that our front desk staff was helpful in assisting you with your Wi-Fi connection to the best of their ability and that they helped connect you with the IT support technician. I sincerely apologize that the connection for Wi-Fi was never made using your laptop and that the support technician was unable to keep you connected. I was happy to see that you were able to connect using a cable. We will continue to look into Wi-Fi connection problems as it is not an ideal situation for our business clientele to deal with. Once again, I sincerely apologize for the issue you encountered and I hope you will continue to be a loyal Ayres guest.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary: Came to town for 30th high schol reunion...checked out of a different hotel for this more convenient location, very happy we did! Staff was friendly and helpful, property clean and nicely decorated; spacious room with desk area, sitting area & fridge/micro. Exceptionally quiet :-D  slept in til 9:30am the morning after our big reunion, a first for us! Great pool & spa with beautiful sunset views. Grocery store and drug store 1 block away, highway on ramps just a few blocks away, minutes to one of the best area restaurants - Peppino's Italian Family Restaurant!
Manager Response: Dear Victoria J,   I want to take the time to thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Mission Viejo and for your glowing review regarding your stay with us. I am thrilled to see that our staff provided you with exceptional service and that you were able to enjoy our complimentary amenities including our relaxing pool and spa area. The views are quite extraordinary and we are proud to showcase our beautiful and convenient location. We do our very best to select only the best areas for our properties and were glad that we were able to exceed your expectations. Once again, thank you for choosing our hotel and for your kind and detailed feedback. We look forward to serving you again in the future!   Best Regards,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary: My fiance and his parents stayed here while we all visited my parents in Mission Viejo.    PROS: Customer service - We had booked 2 rooms online, but only 1 showed up when we arrived.  Front desk representative (Kelly, I think) was very helpful and accommodating and ended up setting us up with 2 rooms at a price that was significantly less than what we had originally booked.  Clean - Hotel was extremely clean.  Didn't find one thing out of place.  Spacious - Not sure if it was the room type or not, but our room was massive. It felt so big; tons of room to move around and included a mini-fridge and spa bathtub.   Atmosphere - Very comfortable and inviting.  And I liked all the little history tidbits about the Ayres from the pictures hanging around the hotel.   "SEMI" CON: Not

My wife and I stay here at least twice a year and have always been extremely pleased.  This time we stayed for a week and had two rooms, one for our daughter.  As usual the rooms were clean and beautifully maintained.  We love the fact that there is a sitting area with a couch, refrigerator, and microwave.  In addition there is a desk and free Wi-Fi to do that work that sometimes happens while on vacation. The staff is always very courteous and friendly.  Miguel in the kitchen serves up a great free breakfast and always remembers me.  We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when we visit family in the area.  Thank you Dean and the staff again for a great stay, See in in November.
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth W,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor about your recent experience at our hotel. Our staff work diligently to create the most relaxing, personal experience around and we’re pleased to hear we were able to exceed your expectations. From our comfortable, clean rooms to our complimentary American breakfast, we are always happy to make it all happen. Thank you again for your kind recommendation and loyalty and we look forward to your return in November!  Warm Regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed there with my daughters softball team and myself and one other mother were  responsible for taking other girls on the team.  I had lots of special requests and wants and they were all met with a smile!  Nicole in particular was just a joy and went above and beyond to help! I will stay there again if we ever have a softball tournament in the area! I highly recommend this hotel. D

What a joy it was to be back at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo!  My wife and I have been staying there for over 10 years and our visits just keep getting better!  The friendly and competent front desk staff go out of their way to assure that your needs are taken care of throughout your visit.  Dean Birtles, General Manager, has hired outstanding staff that provide outstanding service in all areas.  It is very obvious that the hotel's mission is to provide a carefree environment where one can relax and enjoy the beautiful view of the Saddleback Mountains and surrounding valley.  The rooms are spacious, quiet, and well appointed.  The executive rooms have beautiful marble floors in the bathrooms, a comfortable working desk area, and a bar area, complete with microwave,

Our family gathered at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo last weekend for our sons wedding. The stay was absolutely amazing.The rooms were so beautiful and confortable. We enjoyed hanging at the pool with the stunning view and meeting for breakfast in the morning. The entire staff was so friendly and accomodating, special thanks to Doreen for co-ordinating our stay. She was so kind and understanding and immediately responded to any questions or concerns I had pre arrival. Did I mention that the rates are extremely reasonably for such an awesome place. We will reccomend the  Ayres to everyone. Looking forward to our next trip to Mission Viejo and the Ayres Suites..
Manager Response: Dear Connie T,   Thank you very much for your considerate review and we're absolutely thrilled that you chose our hotel as the host for your son's wedding! We're delighted to hear that you and your guests loved our spacious guest rooms, world class amenities, and our friendly and attentive staff. At our hotel, we always strive to provide the best hospitality for all of our guests and we're happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations! We thank you again for your kind words and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic when sports teams are absent
Summary: This is a wonderful property with great amenities...a beautiful pool, excellent hot breakfast, spacious rooms and a peaceful atmosphere....EXCEPT....when sports teams are overnighting.   The halls are full of running screaming athletes, the pool is like a piranha tank, and the breakfast room is like the zoo at feeding time.  I advise to check before you make your reservations.

Summary Heading: Ayres was a perfect get away!
Summary: I just stayed four days at Ayres in Mission Viejo.  Awesome place.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Easy check-in.  Easy check-out.  Great breakfast.  Even a light dinner that was a big surprise!!  It made being away from home so comfortable. The price is amazing when you realize that 5 miles away will cost you 3 times as much.  The rooms are spacious and very nice.

I only stayed one night for my daughter's soccer tournament, but would have been happy to stay longer. There were a lot of classy touches at this unassuming hotel. The complementary breakfast was far from the usual continental. It offered freshly cooked eggs, hash browns, bacon, pancakes on a large open grill with the chef making the food in front of you. Fresh oatmeal, fresh cut up fruit, a variety of yogurts, muffins, bagels and of course, cereal. Also the coffee was really good quality.  The lobby was lovely with fresh giant apples offered everyday. The work out room, extremely clean and nicely laid out.  The rooms were spacious and so comfortable and exceptionally clean. No struggling to figure out lighting and remotes. Microwave and fridge were "quietly" nestled in the
Manager Response: Dear lenoramay324,   Thank you very much for your lovely review and we're so happy that you decided to stay with us for your daughter's soccer tournament! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed our scrumptious continental breakfast, our state-of-the-art fitness room, and our top tier amenities. Our staff always strives for excellent service and we're glad that they made such a grand impression on you and your family. We thank you once again for your kind recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back in the future!  Sincerely,   Dean Birtles  General Manager

Summary: This hotel is impeccably clean, and well managed.
