Guests should have an easy and welcoming first experience with us and we want to ensure this is the case. We appreciate your candidness and hope you will visit us again the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Suites - Mission Viejo - The Best in Orange County, CA
Summary: Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo is not only the BEST place to stay, but the BEST deal in the area.  The staff is incredible.  They have a very, very professional, kind, at-your-service staff that makes everyone feel at home and welcomed.  The Hotel is ALWAYS beautiful, elegant, classy, beyond comfortable, clean...ALWAYS & at a very, very good price.  Full breakfast comes with the price of the room, NOT just danish & coffee.  In the evening, they have wine, beer, salad, various snacks/food (i.e. spagetti, tacos, etc) nachos & on the house.  We will ONLY stay at the Ayres Suites, Mission Viejo when in Orange County, as they are consistantly the BEST place to stay & ALWAYS make you feel at home.  Can't say enough good things about Ayres.  Great place for meetings, too!  They are
Manager Response: Dear Patty -  Thank you so much for your enthusiastic recommendation! We know you have a choice of many hotels in the Orange County area and appreciate you choosing us exclusively. We are always thrilled to know that a guest finds each stay so consistently comfortable. I'm also very pleased the cleanliness of the hotel exceeds your expectations each time you stay with us. Thank you again for your review. We hope your travels bring you to the area again soon.   Warm regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo while on business.  Nice, new property, with good restaurants within a half mile from the property.  Hotel itself is nice but nothing to write home about.  As a suites hotel, I would expected at least two separate rooms (bedroom and sitting room) or at least a sitting area clearly separated off from the bedroom.  But the Ayres Suites are not really suites, at least not my room - it was just a large single room.  Plenty of space to spread out, but not a suites hotel by my definition.  Breakfast was included in the room rate, but the pickings were so-so.  Overall a good value.
Manager Response: Dear NYGuyInMass -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing our hotel for your stay. I am pleased you found such value in your stay though I apologize if the room was not as expected. Our standard rooms are oversized studio suites and we do have one and two bedroom suites available for guests looking for this type of accommodation so please keep this in mind should you visit us again. We are very grateful for your business and hope to welcome you again soon.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Since 2004, Ayres Suites - Mission Viejo has provided a consistent, exceptional experience in lodging.  Whenever my wife and I are in Southern Caifornia, our choice of lodging is always this hotel.  In fact, in 2005, we were guests there for over 30 days and loved every minute of our stay!  The Ayres Suites - Mission Viejo is well managed by Dean Birtles, General Manager, whose attention to detail is evident through the property.  The entire staff makes you feel like a valued client.  Every request is handled graciously and efficiently.  The rooms are beautifully appointed with very comfortable beds, work area (executive rooms), wifi, marble floors in the bathroom area, refrigerator, microwave, and eating area.  The swimming pool is refreshing and always sparkling.  The included

We stayed here while visiting family in the area. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The king suite has a sleeper sofa, small fridge and microwave, and is a good size. Everything is spotless in the hotel. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful and included pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and hash browns all freshly prepared. There is also fresh cut up fruit. In the evenings there is complimentary drinks and snacks which we really couldn't experience since we wete at relatives' homes during the social hours. Definitely a comfortable reasonable hotel with many amenities.

Summary Heading: Still and will always be my 'go to' hotel
Summary: Shortly before my stay at the Ayres, I read the most recent reviews, and I must say, was disappointed and sad that some of the poor reviews were posted.  This hotel is my 'go to' hotel.  The checkin is always fast, rooms extremely clean and so large.  I have never had any problems with the internet, the pool is clean and comfortable, breakfast fresh and plentiful - and the weekly reception dinner always tasty.  This hotel, for the price is an incredible value.  The staff - all of them - make every effort to ensure one's stay is the best it can be.  A good selection of restarunts are just a quick drive down the street, and the highway access convienent. I sleep the best at this hotel than virtually any other I go to.  If you are traveling to southern California and are looking

What a superb hotel! It's in a quiet, mostly residential area, with a great pool and hot tub. The staff are really friendly, and the buildings and grounds are kept beautifully. There's a great choice of hot and cold options for breakfast, tea/coffee/cool drinks are available all day, and there's the bonus of evening snacks/drinks midweek. The bedroom we had was really comfortable, and the housekeeping service was fantastic.
Manager Response: Dear David -  You are so very kind! Thank you so much for your positive review and for choosing our hotel for your visit. It is wonderful to know that you found the accommodations so comfortable and the service warm. We appreciate your recommendation and hope your travels bring you to the area again soon.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We booked about 18 rooms with a multitude of different needs and accommodation setups. Every request was spelled out and reserved ahead of time. The staff was courteous and professional meeting everyone’s needs as they arrived. Adjoining rooms for wedding attendants, 1st floor handicap rooms for grandparents and quiet king suites for parents. The breakfast was great and the breakfast room allowed all of us to gather and catch up with family and friends. The pool was in a good location for young people to have fun without disturbing guests that were resting. A great time was had by all.

I spent a week at the hotel, during which time I found the staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful, housekeeping excellent, not just in the room but in the entire hotel which was spotless.  In addition, the food at the daily breakfast as well as the happy hour I attended was delicious and plentiful, and in fact on the last day of my stay, the cook made me a special breakfast!  Free wi-fi was easy to use and very fast.  The work out room was, as expected by that time, spotless and the equipment it top order, and the pool was great.  I could go on, but in summary, I'll just say it was one of the more enjoyable hotel experiences I've had in quite some time.  Great work Ayres!  I'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear John -  It was wonderful welcoming you to our hotel for a week recently. To be described as "excellent" is just phenomenal and we are thrilled to have provided you with such a comfortable hotel experience. We are so appreciative of your review and hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Three of us stayed in a handicapped room which was large & comfortable, including the sofa bed.  The property is quiet; we heard practically no commotion from several wedding parties (!) staying there.  Hot breakfast is good.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you to our hotel and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. How wonderful to know that the noise level of the property lent itself to a relaxing stay. We are very grateful that you chose us for your visit and hope you will do so again very soon.   Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Its just a bland, chain type hotel.  I don't know why they call it suites, it's just a hotel room with a small sink and microwave in one corner. The decor is strange, they market it as a European style boutique hotel in an italian flavour, which is just laughable. Room had a strange musty odour when I arrived.  On the positive front, the bed was okay, the facilities are good - busy pool, workout room and free wifi, breakfast was nothing special but perfectly acceptable, and the staff are welcoming and efficient.
Manager Response: Dear PhantomHelm -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased that the service and facilities met your needs, I am sorry if your experience with us was anything less than remarkable. We are a small, family owned hotel chain of 20 properties and the family does take great care in choosing the appropriate European-inspired decor. While most guests find this, our spacious guestrooms, and meticulous service to be exceptional,  I do understand this may not suit every person's taste and for that I apologize. Hopefully you will have another opportunity to visit and we will have a second chance to show you how comfortable a stay with us can be.   Regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Very convenient, large rooms, great hot breakfast.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  Everything was very clean and pleasant to the eye.  Very accommodating to smokers by putting on first floor in the rear of the building with a patio- no contact with non-smokers.  This is an added plus to non-smokers because all the smokers are not gathered around entrances smoking when you enter the hotel and no cigarette butts scattered around.  Makes for a much safer alternative for smokers from another time zone.  Will definitely stay at this hotel next time I visit family in the area.  Note though, if you get back on the toll road and exit at Antonio Pkwy, you will be required to pay another $1.50 in toll and must have exact change- no bills!!
The hotel was close to the highway, but we could not hear any noise.  The staff was pleasant and helpful and the morning breakfast was delicious!

Summary Heading: Acceptable, though quite dated room decor...
Summary: My wife and I stayed overnight recently at this Ayres Suites facility, which is right across the parking lot from an Ayres Hotel and Spa building.  Honestly, I can't understand how Ayres can claim these rooms are suites as our room was a standard hotel room with a small refigerator and microwave, NOT in a separate room or alcove.  We've stayed in Hampton Inns with standard rooms that are larger than this "suite".  Also, the room decor was dated, not modern.  The TV was a flat panel which was fine, but the beddings, furniture, light fixtures, etc. all harkened back to the 1960's, maybe even the 1950's.  I realize that these rooms were built and decorated more recently, but that's just the style that Ayres chooses for these rooms.  Are they trying to appeal to older guests?  Not

This was my fourth stay in five years.  Opted to stay again at this lovely facility for 4 reasons:  1. Easy ACCESS and location so I could zip out to Long Beach and other business points in the area  2. CLOSE to family/grandchildren so I could do business around the OC and have time with them each evening.  Brought my wife this time and she was then able to enjoy time during the day.  3. Wonderful and spacious ROOM with all the amenities needed (great cooked breakfast, free wifi, free parking)  4. FAIR price and value for the money.  The same as other comparable hotels, but with no hidden costs for breakfast or parking or internet.  What I had forgotten was #5 - the PEOPLE there.  Setting up a reservation, front desk, breakfast staff, even maintenance (I broke my glasses and a

Friendly, close to a major highway, and clean. So, why not a five. Well, I could give it a 4 1/2, but I really like to spend less. We were there for our family reunion, so we had about 50 people. The pool was small and crowded. No shade. Usually I don't use pools, so I did not deduct for this. This hotel is trying to conserve energy. You have to put your key into a slot to use the lights and other electrical devices. If you leave the room without taking your key, you have to get another to ge in. Didn't deduct for this either. Just a little to expensive for my tastes.
Manager Response: Dear Born2travel2 -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It is wonderful to know that you found the service warm and the cleanliness up to standard. Our guests generally find a great deal of value in our hotel as we include a complimentary full American breakfast, WIFI, parking, and Manager's Reception in our rate, although I do understand that the perceived value may be different for each guest and apologize if this did not meet your needs. However, we do appreciate your review and hope you will give us a second opportunity to welcome you in the near future.   Warm regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We were a bit disappointed in this hotel and quite glad it was a one night experience. The positives were:  A pleasant check in, a good sized bedroom, free Internet, a pool with spa and a comfortable bed. The negative list was longer: a musty room,  no room safe!, the worst breakfast ever, paper thin connecting doors to screaming neighbors, and a 20 minute wait for pool towels. Also, we would have liked a makeup mirror, two (not one) hand towels and softer towels. The door to the bathroom is a broken toe ready to happen. The area can only comfortably support a pocket door.  We missed the evening reception. We returned to the hotel looking forward tothe promised homemade cookies. Naturally only two broken cookies were left. When I mentioned it to the receptionist, she just
Manager Response: Dear AZglass -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased your check-in was seamless and that you enjoyed our variety of complimentary amenities, I do apologize if your overall stay was anything less than exceptional. While we do not offer a safe in our guestrooms, we do have a secure safe at the Front Desk which we encourage our guests to use if they would like. As to the room issues described, we wish nothing more than to meet our guests needs and are always happy to move them to another room when possible should we be alerted to problems. I am sorry if this option was not available in your case and am also sorry regarding the availability of our Manager's Reception refreshments - which are available Monday-Thursday from 5-7 pm. We truly strive for our guests to leave our hotel feeling completely satisfied and hope you will give us another chance to show you that a stay with us can be remarkable. Thank you again for your review.   Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We stay at Ayers all the time and also have our family from out of state and visiting from out of the area stay at Ayers.  They love it as well as us that is why we always return.  The atmosphere, efficiency and professional courtesy is a joy and the rooms, food and accomodations are wonderful for the price. We just are loyal Ayers fans are constantly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Amazing staff, and an enivorment that's breath taking.
Summary: I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay at! The staff was very helpful and friendly! The room was beautiful and the it self area was very relaxing; beautiful to look at, the viberations were amazing! Defintaly going back next year!

Summary Heading: Didn't Live Up to the Hype!
Summary: I guess my expectations were higher due to all the posted rave reviews, but I found the hotel to just be very average (a step above a Ramada). To start, our room had a foul musty or moldy smell.  We were told this is fairly common, as the rooms get "stuffy" when not occupied for a while.  We were told to just run the ceiling fan or A/C and it would go away....it never did!   The best thing about the buffet breakfast was it was free.  The oatmeal was awful, as were the hard as a rock scrambled eggs.   Stick with the boxed cold cereal and you will be fine.  I guess it's an ok bargain, but if you are expecting four star quality accommodations, you will be sourly disappointing.  Lastly, what hotel in the 21st century doesn't have in room movies on demand?!   Free parking and free

Summary Heading: Pretty & clean, great spare room when we're in town visiting family!
Summary: This is off the beaten path, but close to freeways/toll road so you can zip about. The hotel is pretty, the breakfast is nice, the room is comfortable, but the pool is not terribly exciting if you're traveling with swimmers, this is where it loses steam. Like the burbs around it, this is about comfort and cleanliness, not so much about location as there is nothing noteworthy nearby that is walkable.
Manager Response: Dear Roadtripper39 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. How wonderful to know the our location proved convenient and the accommodations and complimentary amenities lent themselves to a satisfactory experience. I am also pleased you were able to take advantage of our close proximity to the 241 as it easily connects to many of Southern California's most visited places. We are appreciative of your recommendation and hope to welcome you again soon.   Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Beautiful hotel!  Very clean and welcoming.  Everyone was very friendly.  The price was great!  My husband and I are so happy to have found a place to stay in such a beautiful location. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia -  We are happy you have found us as well. We love having the chance to welcome guests on multiple stays as it gives us a chance to get to know them that much better. I am pleased you found such value in our hotel and were impressed by our close proximity to Saddleback Mountain. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your return.  Warm regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Visiting Orange County, we were thrilled to find an Ayres Suites nearby our appointments.  Great rooms, HUGE breakfast buffet and even wine/beer and dinner in price.  Probably the best bang for the buck in the area.  They also have a hotel/spa adjoining if you want something simpler.  First stay--we'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear James -  Thank you for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your visit. We know you have quite a selection of hotels to choose from in the south Orange County area so it is wonderful that you chose the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. We love that you were able to take full advantage of our complimentary amenities, including our weekday Manager's Reception and full American breakfast and are thrilled they helped make your stay comfortable. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Safe travels,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: New feel to the hotel.  Staff friendly.  Fair price, especially considering complimentary breakfast and early dinner.
Manager Response: Dear BMelvin1966 -   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It means a great deal to us that you found everything from the decor to the service to the rate conducive to a comfortable stay. Thank you again and please consider us the next time you are in the Mission Viejo area.   Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Very nice, clean, friendly, great price for what you get. Free breakfast. Would stay here again for sure!

Summary Heading: Weary road warrior found solace here...
Summary: From the literally "welcoming" staff to the complimentary (full) breakfast to the complimentary evening wine receptions to the oversized suites with jacuzzi tubs, and views of both Saddleback Mountian and the lake, this hotel gets "it" right.  In a day and age where service has long left the heart of most businesses, it was refreshing to have this hotel staff "get it right". I was never told "no" or "I'm sorry" or "we can't" - only "absolutely", "my pleasure", and "thank you". I have stayed in supposed "world class" hotel chains and independents all over the world and am more than happy to include Ayres in my short list of favorites. I will ABSOLUTELY stay here again when in the OC (Mission Viejo/Foothill Ranch) area.  I was pleasantly surprised and delighted by this hotel and
Manager Response: Dear ATL_Traveler_770 -  Wow! Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for you stay and for your very kind review. We relish the opportunity to provide our guests with exceptional service and accommodations, so it is wonderful to hear that each of these things, most specifically the service, made such a lasting impression on you. To be included in a guest's list of favorites is such an honor and we cannot thank you enough for your patronage. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we look forward to welcoming you again the next time you are in the area.   Many thanks,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but out of the way
Summary: Good rooms with great beds. Fairly standard breakfast buffet with god coffee. Out of the way from the main roads. Free wifi and parking are nice
Manager Response: Dear Dave -  We appreciate your candid review of our hotel. While I am thrilled you found the guestrooms comfortable, I am sorry if the location was not suitable for your needs. The 241 Toll Road, which connects many parts of Orange County, is close to our hotel and many guests find this convenient for their travel desires, but I do understand that it may not have been useful in your case. We do have a sister hotel in the South Orange County area (Laguna Woods) so perhaps on your net visit you will consider it as it is close to major Southern California highways and attractions. We appreciate your review and hope you will choose our chain again in the future.   Warm regards,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean place, good people, city light views.
Summary: Jeff and Nichole were awesome!  Highly suggest talking to them if you can, their customer service skills are amazing.   Hotel itself is a hotel, with an awesome view of the city light below and great rates. Lived it!

This was our second time staying at the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. The hotel was extremely clean, neat and all of the staff were very friendly. They even opened the dining room an hour early for us because we had to be at the fields by 7. They were very accomodating. The kids also loved the pool and spa!
Manager Response: Dear Benay -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you to our hotel a second time. It means a great deal to hear that we were able to make this stay as comfortable and accommodating as the first. We know a full breakfast is important to the start of an athlete's day, especially during competition, so it was our absolute pleasure to make sure you were able to get into the dining room early. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back a third time!  Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: Tawny was thee most amazing leader at Ayres going above and beyond to service the customers needs. Dean was great at finding out exactly who on the staff was doing an excellent job, and I think he is looking at promoting talent. Nichol was great, the M-Th Food included Breakfast and Dinner -Free They have a pool and Jacuzzi with an awesome sunset view. But in hindsight Tawny was the one that would stop what she was doing, step out from behind the desk podium to service the clients needs as if it was thee most important thing in the world at that moment. They also have free cookies day and night with some apples near by for the healthy, and free juice type drings all day and night. The rooms have those pillows that you just sink into perfectly, and when I forgot a razor one day
Manager Response: Dear Alfred -  You honor us with your very kind review. I am thrilled we were able to provide you with the warm service and comfortable accommodations that made your stay with us remarkable. A special thanks for you comments regarding Tawny as well. She is an integral part of the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo team and I assure you your comments will be shared with her so she understands how valuable she is to us and our guests. We deeply appreciate being your choice of hotel in Mission Viejo and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: May 29, 2012 stay at Ayers Mission Viejo
Summary: As always, my stay at the Ayers was excellent. The "check in" was swift and efficient, the room exceptionally clean, comfortable and very adequately accomodating. I enjoyed the stay, as I always do, and look forward to staying there frequently on my future business trips to the Orange County area.  Tom Cheuvront   Cheuvront Consulting group
Breakfast staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room and property were very clean.

We stayed at this property this weekend as part of an extended family event. Our room was clean and well-appointed; my mother was supposed to have a particular handicapped-accessible room, but was given one that was a mirror image (which, if you are disabled, you know can be problematic for certain disabilities). We made it work. Service was prompt, except for when we arrived late (10pm ish) to check in and there was a "back in 10 minutes sign" on the counter...but no indication of WHEN that 10 minutes started, if you know what I mean (normally I wouldn't care, but we were exhausted and had two little kids in the backseat). Breakfast was very good and the cooks both days were very kind and accommodating. My extended family is QUITE loud and boisterous, but we were very well

We held a business event at this location and could not have been any more pleased.  Dean (the General Manager) and Jeanette (Sales Manager) absolutely made sure it was a location we were proud to bring out business clients to.  They were easy to work with.  Service was fast.  The room was lovely and the location right off the toll road was perfect.  We'll definitely be going back.
Not really fancy but clean and very friendly/helpful staff. They try hard.

Summary Heading: Ayres - Mission Viejo is the BEST
Summary: Ayres - Mission Viejo is the BEST hotel to stay in, when in Orange County.  The staff is absolutely the best, making sure your stay is the best ever.  They are all so friendly, yet very, very professional and make you feel very welcomed.  They serve a full breakfast, that is very, very good.  They serve at happy hour, salads, nachos, sometimes soups, tacos, & a variety of foods.  You don't need to leave the hotel for any reason, unless for business.  The hotel is consistently CLEAN and very CLASSY.  We won't stay at any other hotel when in Orange County.  They are right off the toll road, which is very handy.  We love the staff & atmosphere at Ayres.  You will too!!!!!

We had an enjoyable experience. The lobby was large and nice, the check in was fast and easy. The hallways were clean with chairs and tables along the sides. No cleaning people around getting in the way. The room was large! We had a king bed with a sofa and coffee table, extra chairs and a desk. There was a wet bar in the room, too! We liked that it included breakfast in the price. The place was quiet and I would stay there again!

Summary Heading: Graceful atmosphere, comfort and attention to detail made our stay at Ayres Suites phenomenal.
Summary: Clean, quiet and great service! Full breakfast and dinners made this a tremendous value when combined with the other amenities. The staff was marvelous! Our new go-to hotel when visiting Orange County.

This was our first stay at the Ayres. We loved our two bedroom two bath room. The room was clean, which is always my #1 concern. Each room had a small refrigerator, you will only be able to keep beverages or small items in it. Also, it will not get your items very cold. The staff were friendly and helpful. They allowed us and the rest of our group to check in early Friday morning. They also provided us with toothpaste because we forgot to pack some. It is the little things like this that sets the Ayres apart from other hotels I have stayed at. It was very relaxing and quite, It seemed like we were the only people staying there. The breakfast was nice and freshly cooked although not a big selection. I hope to visit Mission Viejo and the Ayres again. My best hotel experience so
I always stay here when traveling to San Juan Capistrano.  Rooms are clean, easy access, staff friendly.
Manager Response: Dear KwSacramento -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It is wonderful to know that every element of the hotel, including the cleanliness and service, made your stay with us so exceptional. As stated our location is only a short drive from many south Orange County cities, making it the perfect location for guests visiting family in the area or perhaps wanting to stay very near certain hot Southern California attractions like the Irvine Spectrum and various beaches. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your return.   Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I always stay at the Ayres Hotel when I'm competing at the Rancho Mission Viejo Riding park. For horse show folk, they offer a fantastic discount.  The price can't be beat for such a lovely hotel. The rooms are large and gracious, beautifully furnished, and they provide a mini bar with microwave and refrigerator which is great because I don't like to eat out every night when I'm competing.  If you do want to eat in, they have a great breakfast (part of their service) with the best home cooked oatmeal ever and super snacks, a light meal, and complimentary wine at dinner time.  They always make me feel like a returning VIP every time I visit!
Manager Response: Dear Br0dieGirl -   It was a pleasure welcoming you to Ayres Suites Mission Viejo once again. We appreciate being your choice of hotel when competing in horse shows. As stated we do often offer specials for those who are a part of horse shows so I am pleased you are able to take advantage of these offers. It is also wonderful to know you are so consistently satisfied with the service and accommodations offered by the hotel. Please keep in mind that right across the parking lot our sister hotel, Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo, is home to the Modjeska Grill, which offers delicious and affordable fare. This may be an option for you should you decide you DO want to eat out before a show during one of your visits. Thank you again for your recommendation. We look forward to your return.  Sincerely,   Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: I highly recommend Ayres Mission Viejo to anyone on business or a "get away". I stay at this hotel at least twice a week for business and when visiting the OC with my family I choose to stay here as well.  the service is exceptional.
I always enjoy staying at your hotel.People are friendly and accommodating,Rooms are comfortable and always clean.
Manager Response: Dear Neil -  Thank you so much for your kind words and for choosing Ayres Suites Mission Viejo once again. I am pleased you find the accommodations and service so consistently comfortable. It is also wonderful to hear that the cleanliness of the hotel held up to the very high standards of our guests. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Warm regards,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We had a great time again at the Ayres, we recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a place to stay while visiting Mission Viejo, especially Miguiel the chef that provides breakfast. The hotel located in an area where we can visit the entire LA area and San Diego. We will be staying hre in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Willie -  We greatly appreciate your positive feedback. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. Our breakfast team works very hard to ensure the complimentary full American breakfast offered is a quality meal as we know breakfast is an important start to anyone's day. I will be sure to pass along your compliments to Miguel as he is an integral part of our team. Thank you again for your review. We look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here numerous times over a 5 year period and always have been very pleased.  The staff is very friendly, the hotel and the rooms are clean and comfortable and well maintained.  We like to stay here because we can access many Southern CA attractions easily without paying the premium room rates of closer hotels.They serve a good complimentary breakfast daily, with many options and dinner Monday - Thursday.  Beds were very comfortable, especially the pilllows.  The lime-strawberry ice water & cookies served at night is an extra nice touch.
Manager Response: Dear 5of6 -  Thank you very much for your kind review and for your continued patronage. We are always thrilled to welcome repeat guests and are glad to know that our proximity to the many Southern California attractions, such as Disneyland and the Irvine Spectrum, as well as our complimentary amenities contribute to a consistently comfortable and affordable stay. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: The Ayres is an ideal hotel for extended business travel.  The breakfast and happy hour are very helpful.  The rooms are really nice, and the exercise room is fine.  I would stay there again for another business trip.
Manager Response: Dear Pat -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. We know it is very important for those traveling on business, especially for extended periods, to have the most comfortable and inviting accommodations possible during time away from home, so I am delighted that we were able to make your stay so exceptional. A guest recommendation and impending return is the highest honor a hotel can receive and your is greatly appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you again.  Safe travels,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: They actually read the survey comments!
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times on business.  The first two times, I didn't bother responding to the emailed survey after my stay.  Finally, I did, and I was pleasantly suprised.  The next time I stayed, during the check-in process, my comments for improvement from the previous survey were recognized and addressed!  I couldn't believe it!  The rooms at this hotel are gigantic, the pool area great (heated pool), breakfast is awesome, and the free reciption during the week is a nice touch.  There is always plenty of parking and the staff very friendly.  Great hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Becky -  It was an honor having you as a guest once again. Thank you for taking the time to inform fellow travelers about your experience at Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. Feedback from our guests is of the utmost importance, as guest response is how we go about improving the overall hotel experience to ensure the most comfortable stay possible. I appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience on our survey and am so pleased that we were able to rise to the level of your expectations. It is also wonderful to hear that you found the room and amenities, including the complimentary breakfast, to your liking. I will be sure to share your comments with the team here at the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you again.  Safe travels,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary Heading: Bigger room than expected, comfy bed.  Skip the breakfast.
Summary: Just stayed 1 night to minimize drive home from a party.  Room was spacious and clean however a very "musty" smell upon check in.  Dissipated with window open.  I can only think it's the automatic electricity cut-off that is the culprit.  When you are in the room, you put your cardkey on the wall to turn on the electricity.  A great conservative approach but when not there maybe the air turns off?  Anyway, that was the only issue but minor.  Bed and linens comfortable.  Breakfast was not up to par.  Everything pre-prepared and in warmer by 8 AM.  My guess is big batch made at 6am.  Skip it and grab some Starbucks nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Adam -  Thank you so much for your review of Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. While I am pleased to know you found the room and accommodations comfortable overall, I apologize for any odor in the room and that the breakfast was not to your liking.   Most of the Ayres Hotels are equipped with energy saving devices designed to turn off electricity, including air conditioning but excluding refrigerators, when a guest leaves the room. We do take cleanliness and housekeeping responsibilities very seriously, so this lack of circulation may account for any room odor and I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.   As to the breakfast, we serve fresh, cooked to order breakfast or a breakfast buffet depending on the occupancy level of the hotel. I will review your comments with the breakfast team so appropriate steps will be taken to ensure maximum freshness when occupancy levels are high.   I appreciate your comments and hope we can welcome you again soon.  Regards,  Dean Birtles General Manager

Summary: We have just returned from our fifth year stay at Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo!  This time we stayed for three weeks.  We can't say enough about this hotel, the General Manager Dean Birtles and his competent and very pleasant staff.  It is like our "home" away from home! The hotel is always spotless, the housekeeping staff is so hard-working and pleasant as is Miguel who looks after us serving a full breakfast, always with a smile.   The rooms are very spacious and the bed so very comfortable as was the pillows!  The pool area is beautiful and spotless! There is nothing negative about this hotel and we look forward to returning to the Ayres again next year!

Summary Heading: If in South Orange County.. This is the place to stay!
Summary: I am very impressed with Ayres Suites-MV. The staff was warm, friendly and worthy of this classy hotel. My room was spacious, modern and clean. I slept like a baby in one of the most comfortable beds I've experienced. Even the pillows were nice and fluffy! At breakfast, I met Dean (The GM). I expressed how happy I was with everything including the hot breakfast! I'm looking forward to my next visit to South OC. You know we're I'll be staying!!

Summary Heading: Ayres Suites, Mission Viejo, Is The Best
Summary: When staying in Orange County I don't stay at any other hotel.  The hotel has special rates during the Christmas season, which really helps with all of the other expenses associated with the holidays. The staff is courteous and very accommodating, and the rooms are very comfortable.  I LOVE the beds and wonderful bed linens.  The made-to-order breakfast is wonderful, and if you don't like scrambled eggs you can order them fried or as an omelet.  On weeknights a light dinner and complimentary beer & wine are served, a welcome treat at the end of a long day.  This is a family-owned, first class hotel at a very reasonable price!

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff - Comfy Bed- Good Breakfast
Summary: The front desk staff were very friendly. The beds were comfortable, I usually dont get much sleep when I stay at hotels, but I slept well here. The continental breakfast was good as well. Good experience will be happy to stay there again.

Summary Heading: The Ayres Suites Mission Viejo Wonderful Experience
Summary: This is the BEST hotel, as far as we are concerned, in Orange County.  We will only stay, when in Orange County, at the Ayres Suites Mission Viejo.  It is First Class all the way at reasonable prices.  The At-Home-Comfort is the BEST.  Our room is ALWAYS Classy, Comfortable & Clean....ALWAYS!  They have pillow top beds that are very, very comfortable.  The staff is beyond accommodating and takes care of any necessities at a moments notice.  The staff maintains the hotel with the utmost care.  There are snacks/mini dinner and wine in the evenings & breakfast is the best.  Breakfast is complimentary and it is NOT just danish and coffee.  There are fresh made scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, juices, coffee & milk.  We highly recommend staying at

We had such a good experience at the Laguna Woods Ayres that we stayed three nights at the Mission Viejo Ayres for a slightly lower daily rate while promotional Christmas-New year tariffs were in force.  We were not disappointed.  Service is friendly, and we always enjoy the cookies available in the evenings.  We tried the evening snack which was nachos and cheese and chili with cheese.  One could actually make an evening meal out of the snack.  Breakfasts were included, and even when the grill was not working one morning, we still got scrambled and hard boiled eggs.  We notice most guests left a dollar in the tip basket when they ordered omelets or fried eggs, as if they were buying the service from the cook.  Maybe that is an American tipping custom now.  We printed our
great value, excellent service and breakfast, clean, comfortable, quiet rooms

Warm, welcoming gracious and helpful staff, comfortable spacious rooms, extensive hot breakfast, Manager's Reception/casual dinner, oven fresh cookies at the desk, great pool, free parking and wifi, excellent location off the 241 freeway and close to amenities ... whatever you're looking for, this hotel has for less than comparative hotels in the area.  Best place to stay in Orange County that I've found after years of travel to this area.

I've stayed before and it's always been awesome.  Staff is friendly and helpful.   They have a full hot breakfast that is very good.  Rooms are clean.  Beds are comfortable.  I will always stay here when in the area.
This hotel has the best hotel I have ever stayed in. great family atmosphere.  Great value. Beds are very comfortable. Great breakfast! Great customer service

As a nervous senior citizen, I worry about traveling and staying in an unfamiliar hotel.  I must say that the people on the staff did everything possible to make my stay pleasant.  They not only met my needs, they anticipated and exceeded them.  It reminded me of the service in some fine European hotels I stayed in years ago.   The breakfast was a definite plus.  I had a long drive and wanted an early start.  The food was ready at the early hour, the service staff very helpful.
great hotel,right off the toll road,,,,quiet and a friendly staff,,,,,,good breakfast also,,,,,

I stayed at the hotel for business then later with my daughter.  The hotel was comfortable and had very nice art work.  We were offered breakfast, small evening meal, and night time cookies.  This made for a good value.  The staff was excellent.  Everyone was helpful and very friendly.  It appears that everyone in every position understands the impotance great customer service.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel at a Very Reasonable Rate
Summary: This is likely one of the cleanest hotels I have ever seen. The staff was attentive and friendly. A perfect little hotel that delivers a lot for the nightly rate.

We are frequent guests at Ayres Suites because the experience is always a positive one.  The customer service is excellent.  The hotels are well maintained and the price is reasonable for the accommodations.

Rewriting my previous review - for some reason the star rating came out as 1 when i meant 5 star rating, for sure! This hotel was a convenient location from my son's wedding @Dove Canyon country club (Beautiful Venue). The exceptional staff - esp. DiDi and Tawny at the front desk, the plumber who unplugged a toilet and the maid who cleaned the groomsmen's room (think Animal House) after several nights' partying - were All Incredible and went the Extra mile w/a smile. The breakfast included was quite good. The $107/night wedding party rate was such a Great Value! Thanks to all of you there who helped make our wedding weekend Perfect!! My best friends got upgraded to Rm. 321 (2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 jacuzzi's) - would recommend for families w/children, 2 couples, or anyone who

We had a lot of guests staying here for a wedding and the staff was incredibly accommodating and helpful. We had a lot of little demands related to the wedding, and the staff did not even bat an eye. We were also very pleased with the accommodations themselves. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Rooms are passable but not great, and have a terribly annoying feature.  One of your key cards must be inserted in a slot on the wall or the power will be cut off to the whole room.  That issue alone would keep me from returning. Staff can range from really friendly to very rude.  Would make another hotel choice on future visits.
Manager Response: Dear Matt -  Thank you very much for your review of Ayres Suites Mission Viejo. I am terribly sorry that you were unimpressed with your stay with us.  A majority of our hotels are equipped with energy saving devices in the room. These conserve electricity by turning off just the lights and air conditioning in the room when the key card is removed and assist us in creating a greener, more eco-friendly hotel. I am sorry if you were caused any inconvenience by this feature. We also try exceedingly hard to make sure each guest knows he or she is highly valued during interactions with the front desk by providing a warm and helpful environment. I apologize that your interactions were so varied and inconsistent.  Please know that your comments are being taken seriously and shared with our team to ensure all guests leave their stay with us fully satisfied. Again thank you for your review, and I hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future and giving us the chance to impress you.  Dean Birtles General Manager Ayres Suites Mission Viejo

Summary: My boyfriend and I were in town for a friends' wedding and stayed here for 4 nights. The service is impeccable and down to earth at the same time. The bed and pillows were flawlessly comfortable.  We had no problems with neighbor noise or climate control. The hotel offers great views of the sunset from the end of the hall. The outdoor pool is great for wading and enjoying the views. The Ayres Suites shares a parking lot with the Ayres Spa. The location is tucked into a somewhat isolated part of Mission Viejo, but we had no issues with it as we had a GPS. Would highly recommend and definitely stay here next time.

We try to always stay with Ayres, and this hotel was great. All of the service and staff and housekeeping was top notch. I am also a hotel owner and recognize a great accommodation, and this is one. thank you very much

I chose this hotel because the most important factor is that it has a fridge and microwave. It also has an outdoor heated pool which was great to hang around in between games and at night. If you are playing near Oso park this hotel is ten minutes away. There is a tons of food located within one block to five minutes up the road. I did not hear any outside noise, there was no hallway noise and I could not hear steps or people above me or next to me. I am very impressed.   The only complaints I have is that I thought each room came with a couch pull out. That is not the case.. only king bed rooms have the couch pullout. The double queens is just a normal size hotel room with two queen beds.   Also, they are energy friendly so when you leave your room you cannot keep on the air or

This hotel was recommended to us by family and I will agree with them that it is a great place to stay. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are clean and the expanded continental breakfast is good.

Summary Heading: I would not stay at any other hotel!!!!
Summary: This will be my fourth trip to southern Ca., and I have stayed here all four times.  The staff is not only professional and curtious, but are a bit on the crazy side.......I LOVE THIS!!!! I have never experianced an atmosphere like the Ayres. They have a truly unique way of treating guests.  The rooms are great..the breakfast totaly blew me away on my first stay. A chef serving breakfast???........complimentary?????......WOW!!! Sure beats continental or a $10.00 charge like at Marriot. I highly recommend this hotel...and I highly recommend the Italian resturant just down the street. I believe it is Piccalinos, however I may have the spelling wrong. You will not be dissapointed. Did I mention that this hotel is fantastic?

Everything about this hotel was wonderful.  The room was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean.  The breakfast that came with the meal was much more than a continental breakfast and was a very pleasant surprise.  The guy on the desk when we arrived was friendly and very helpful and recommended a good restaurant for our evening meal.  If we hadn't have been travelling onto San Diego we would have been happy to spend more time at this hotel.  My husband also used the pool and said it was good too.

Summary Heading: Loved it - would stay here again.
Summary: We were only at the Ayres Suites for one night (Saturday).  Location was not important to us so I can't speak to that.  Checking in was a breeze and the staff was very helpful.  The room was beautiful and clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  We saw lots of families and this seems like a great place for families.   The room was nicely appointed.  The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub/shower combo.  Bath for one but shower was nice and roomy.  If I'm back in Mission Viejo again I will definitely stay here again.  Oh yes - there is free breakfast every day.  It's not fancy but it is better than your normal continental breakfast.  You get hot scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, toast, pancakes, hot and cold cereal, fruit, and juice.  We enjoyed it.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Family with Two Teenagers
Summary: Stayed at the Ayers Inn and Suites July 8 through July 13 and the purpose of our travel was a lacrosse tournament.  We did not stay in a suite, but the room had adequate space for a family of four.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was very accomodating.  The included full breakfast was one of the best ones I have experienced over my travels in the last few years.   I highly recommend this property if you are staying in the Mission Viejo area.

Summary Heading: Thanks for the $55 toll road ticket!
Summary: Spent one night, hotel nice enough.  I think they put new carpet in because it looked pretty new and there was an off-gassing smell, sort of like new car smell.  Room was large, nicely appointed, clean.  Lobby was nicely decorated & the staff nice enough.  The complimentary breakfast was a 4 or 5 out of 10.  Not great, not terrible.  Nothing gourmet about it..  They ought to have more condiments than ketchup & tobasco.  A female desk clerk gave us printed mapquest directions to Hanna's Restaurant in Rancho Santa Margarita (turns out was very closeby) but unfortunately didn't tell us that if we followed HER directions, we would have to use toll roads.  We were short on change but stuck having to go though the toll road, so for a 5 cent change shortage, I'm pretty sure we will be

Summary Heading: Very nice, comfortable and excellent staff
Summary: Courteous, responsive staff made my stay pleasant and comfortable. From check-in to check-out, all staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was good, served in a modest but nice room that was well maintained and clean. Rooms were well appointed and business friendly.

We were in Mission Viejo, CA for a friend's birthday party.  My sister in law booked this hotel for us.  We arrived late on a Thursday night and were greeted by a very nice young man at the front desk.  Check in took a matter of minutes and we were off to our rooms. Right after grabbing a couple of sugar cookies available at the front desk.  The room was spacious and super clean, with a sitting area, two flat screen TVs, a desk, a wonderful and spacious counter over the refigerator/microwave.  The bathroom was equally spacious and clean.  It is an energy efficient hotel, so I agree, the lighting was bit dim for the big area.  We love the breakfast that was available in the morning. Had the basics, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, fruit, oatmeal, bagels, toast, and the ability to

Stayed in the newer spa building. The room was roomy, nicely decorated, comfortable and clean with luxurious touches. The staff was friendly and professional. The breakfast was above expectations even though we didn't realize until too late that you could request a custom-made omelet directly from the cheerful chef. As noted in other reviews, the heating unit under the window was noisy and a little challenging to operate. We turned it off overnight and asked for additional blankets (we arrived in a cool spell of weather.)

We stayed at the Ayres, Mission Viejo  last week  while our house was being remodeled.  The staff was so friendly and the amenities were plentiful.  The room was big with a micro wave, and fridge.  The hot breakfast was great and we were surprised there was even a light dinner Mon- Thur.  The room was comfortable and clean too.  Would stay again in a heartbeat.

We stayed over for a local wedding, our party had booked almost every room.   Rooms were very comfortable, clean and large.   Service was very basic, as you expect from this style of property.  The small number of staff we met were very friendly yet professional. If you need full service, they have another non-suite style property almost next door. Can't comment on value as we had a group deal. I'd certainly go back.

Summary Heading: A great hotel, a little off the beaten path
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres on two occasions recently for long weekends with my kids.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The rooms are spacious and gave everyone the opportunity to spread out.  The complimentary breakfast was nothing special and we opted to eat elsewhere a couple mornings.  Our first room faced west and I could make out the Pacific Ocean in the distance on a clear day.  The view was definitely a pleasant surprise.

Summary Heading: Air Conditioner is inadequate and too noisy for sleeping.
Summary: The air conditioner is a radiator-like looking thing under the window.  It does not do a good job of cooling the room.  When it's on, it's okay, when it automatically stops, you get hot.  There are two settings, low and high, we used high.  It's noisy when it starts up again during the night, it's loud enough to disturb your sleep.  The window opens about four inches, which we needed because the room smelled of old cigarette smoke, but the freeway noise was audible.  Especially since there was something on the freeway that rattled as the cars went over it.      The bathroom sink is open to the room.  There is no door, no separate room for the bathroom sink.  It's been removed from the toilet/shower room, and placed in the bedroom.   If you want to sleep while your spouse is

I spent two weekend nights at Ayres Suites.  The king room was large, with a sofa, desk, microwave, and small frig.  It was spotlessly clean and the bed was comfortable.  Because of the construction, I asked for and got a room on the opposite side of the hotel.  The breakfast staff person was very friendly, and the food selection was good, particularly the fresh fruit.  The desk staff was remarkably patient with my repeated requests for information, and they offered to print out directions for the various places I was visiting while in town.  The rates, obtained through an online service, were terrific.  The pool was too cold to use, but the jacuzzi was perfect.

This hotel has a beautiful lobby and comfortable, spacious rooms, but the service is not so great. My fiance and I interacted with four different people at the front desk during our stay, and two of them were snobby and rude, and one of them even lied to us. The other two were professional and courteous.  I really liked the room, which had a king-sized bed and feather pillows, tv, microwave, refrigerator, and jacuzzi tub. The walls and windows were very good at blocking at sound, but we were close to the elevator, and the doors let in a lot of hallway traffic noise. The hotel is "eco-conscious" so all electricity is controlled by putting the room key into a slot in the wall.
